I was really looking forward to coming here. I had waited all week for the reservation and had high hopes. I guess I had imagined a nice white linen table cloth restaurant with good food and good service... What put me off the most was the entrance lobby. I opened the door and could hardly get in because of the amount of people loitering in the entrance lobby. I couldn't see where the hostess was and it felt stuffy and overcrowded. When I did find the hostess, we were sent to the bar area to wait for the table. Again, very overcrowded, full of tourists, not locals like I would have expected, you could not get a seat anywhere in the bar. It was also very off putting that a few people were eating their food at bar area. When we eventually fended are way to the table through the crowds of tourists, I just felt the whole place was dusty and dirty and not what I had imagined. I know it has history and is old but that doesn't excuse it being unclean. The pictures on the wall next to my table were so dusty, no one clearly hasn't wiped them down for a very long time. The food was ok but I just couldn't enjoy it because I felt so uneasy. We left , but getting my coat was another drama, again because there were so many people blocking the lobby entrance. If I were the manager, I would look at this straight away. Its like a Mcdonalds when you walk in. Just madness. I would not return to this restaurant. A tourist trap and a dirty one at that.

We love going to Keen‚Äôs Steakhouse. The food is excellent, atmosphere so intriguing and service excellent! Best steak in town in our opinion. We enjoy visiting every time we go to NYC!

Keens is one of the best Steakhouses I've been to in NY. The service is excellent and the atmosphere suits couples, friends and business patrons. I highly recommend the New York Sirloin steak. Due to the popularity it's suggested that you make a reservation
Came from Toronto, Canada just to try this fantastic restaurant... Amazing food and service!!!!!! Would go back in a heartbeat :)

Best steak I ever had! I had the 10oz filet mignon. Melt in your mouth! The French onion soup as an appetizer was phenomenal‚Äî-I highly recommend! We shared the twice baked potato‚Äînote‚Äîmeal unto itself! I highly recommend this place! You won‚Äôt regret!

column3: The porterhouse alone is worth the visit!
column4: Few places live up to the hype, this one transcends it! Not only is the steak tender and juicy, the fries, the mushrooms and the key lime pie are alone worth the visit! Top notch food and service!
Ambiance =excellent Food=terrific Staff= friendly A memorable experience in New York, I had the sword fish and my husband a Steak both were really good.

column3: One of the best steak houses in NYC
column4: Great steaks in a historic setting. Be sure to ask for a seat in the main dining area (downstairs/street level). Multiple menu choices, excellent in house bar. Convenient midtown location.
I love this place ! The meat is amazing and the staff very professional and very friendly. I highly recommend this place for dinner with friends.

We just love this place! Have dined here many times over the last decade and have never left unhappy. The mutton chop, prime rib, and the sundae are all worth a drive into the city. Will return over and over again.

column3: Go for the steak stay for the moose
column4: The service was excellent and the smoked bacon appetizer was outstanding. The ambiance was amazing. Where else can you dine under A bull moose shot by Teddy Roosevelt? The steaks were good but nothing special. Still a great place for a special occasion

Great place for business dinners. Expensive. Good quality meat (but I had better). The main room with all the pipes in the ceiling and the old time photos in the walls is something to see and enjoy. The porterhouse for 3 was perfect

Food was delicious, staff exceptional. Nothing more to say. Booking essential. Between 3 of us we shared a starter and main (thick cut bacon then the chateaubriand). All delicious. We will return for sure.
The winning dish was a bass fish. The steak was very large and the test - Amazing. The waiters were courteous. I'd love to visit again
Ate here on Saturday with a friend. We had the mutton chop, Rib eye and fillet between us and all were absolutely amazing. Would highly recommend this restaurant.
The mutton chops are amazing! Side dishes are big enough for 2 and it was easy to book on open table.
Celebrated my 50th birthday here. Great steak dinner and excellent drinks. The bar area was quite busy with the single crowd. Only complaint was they don‚Äôt have rib eyes which is my favorite.
This is the "steakhouse"! Best T-bone and filet mignon in town... very good service and decoration is so classic.
My family had lunch at Keen‚Äôs as the grande finale meal for our vacation. Excellent meal and excellent service. We‚Äôd definitely go back.
Super once again. Never let me down in 30 years. Thank you Keens and thank you Luke. The service and food here are special. Last night clams, oysters, steak, carrot cake. Simply wonderful
Excellent food, wine, cocktail menu. Service was fantastic. Steaks cooked to perfection. Definitely pricey but worth it.
the food here is amazing. Starve yourself for a week before going as the servings are large. The steaks are just delicious and beautifully cooked. Service excellent.

The steaks were fine, they were tough, especially the porterhouse steak, appetizers were great. Two people order the mutton chop and they were tough also. Very packed, but the food was not worth the price,

Great New York quality steakhouse. In my opinion, there are several steakhouses in New York that are exceptional and this is one of them. The steaks were great and the sides were very good. The price was a little pricey but this is New York.
Amazing staff treated us well! Enjoyed our dinner so much, the steak is the perfection. Loved it!!!!
Good food but not necessarily great value. The steak was cooked to our order and the wine list was extensive. The seafood was so so...
Fabulous food in a very busy restaurant and bar. Service was good even though we had a slightly longer wait than expected for the table, but it was worth the delay.
There's a reason that this place is a landmark in NYC. Go for the steak or go more traditional for Keens and go for the mutton chops. Really a fantastic place.
Steak was in point. The Service was friendly and they recommendations good. Drinks were also surprisingly good

Fantastic steakhouse. Very traditional New York style steakhouse. Great meat and wine. Great before and after a show depending on your schedule. Highly suggest in midtown. One of the best in the city.
WOW!! The motton chop was out of this world. really enjoyed eating it and the pipes on the ceiling made the whole experience special.
Went for dinner while on holiday, recommended by our hotel... food average, service a little hurried, all sides additional charge for all... wouldnt be rushing back.

We had heard about this historic steakhouse for a few years. Finally went. Absolutely fantastic. Been to many NYC steakhouses and this was the best experience of all. Very historic place. The food, service and atmosphere were great. We will be back!

I wish they had a ribeye, but this place is still incredible. the ambiance is out of this world and i love the fact that they have the pipes on the ceiling. we had the steak for two and we were very satisfied.

Great beef, great place and service. Prices are fair when you take the quality into consideration. I can recommend the T-bone. The wine card is also great and prices are fair. All in all a great place to visit
This was my favorite steak house during my last stay in Manhattan. I had the legendary Mutton Chops and it was a treasure. My son had the Lamb Chops which were also prepared to perfection.

This restaurant was recommended and we ended up going twice in one week. If you enjoy steaks fast for the day because the portions are huge!! Great service and ambience. The waiters made us feel welcome and relaxed and will definitely be back
My husband and I had dinner here. Sadly for us it was ruined by the next table who thought it was appropriate to swear and talk at the top of their voices.

Now I know why Keens has been around so long. Great food, great service. The staff was very professional, giving you enough space to enjoy a meal. Steak and sides were all amazing. Will eat here every time I am in town.

Keens has been making steak eaters happy for years and the tradition goes on. The place has a fantastic ambience. The service is superb and the food is wonderful! We had a mini family reunion and we couldn't have picked a better place.

column3: no need to eat steak in this steakhouse
column4: I don¬¥t eat meat and my husband is a crazy carnivore. The experience is very nice, service was spotless. Was nice to acknowledge about the place history and it's particular and traditional decoration. The new york cheesecake is a very good option as a dessert.
We love Keens. We stopped in the scotch bar first and sampled a rare scotch. Then into the dining room for stars and lamb. The food is always great, and the service if fabulous.
The ambiance was great it gives you the feel of old New York. Dinner and the service was great. If steak is what you want then look no further than Keens!!
Read reviews so booked this restaurant for our 25th anniversary meal. Lovely place, good service and great food. Well worth a visit...but book to avoid disappointment.
For a guy who used to eat red meat, this is saying a lot. The Artic Char, unreal! The baked potatoes and veggies roasted were outstanding!

Corporate dinner with most of the group ordering steak. Some of the steaks wee served so underdone that they were sent back to the kitchen, which spoiled the experience. Otherwise god quality and interesting offerings. Expensive, but no more so than the rest of NYC.
Food elevated!! From the first plate to dessert... delicious!!!! Very Knowledgeable staff and impeccable service! Wonderful atmosphere, warm hospitality and delicious wines!! Can‚Äôt wait to go back!

column3: A must for those visiting NY
column4: Lovely atmosphere, melt in the mouth steak(we had the porterhouse to share) and great service. Beware of those American portions and be prepared to pay for quality!
Everything perfect from the service to the meal! We really enjoyed the relaxed pace, never rushed. Relaxing meal!
The steak was tasty but not up to my high standards of the last few steaks I‚Äôve had. Friendly staff and interesting atmosphere.

Many places claim to be legendary, but this one really is. To go straight to the point: I had both the mutton and the king's cut. Both are very generous and savory, but first-time visitors should really go for the mutton, because it is delicious,...More

I knew before booking our reservation that this restaurant would be expensive. It was well worth it for one great evening. Everything was exceptional except the bill, which will run you $100+ a person; so be prepared to spend some coin! Regardless of the price, again Keens is more than worth it! There was not one thing cooked incorrectly, i.e. - crab cakes, steaks, puffy blue cheese, carrot cake, etc..
Everything perfect from the service to the meal! We really enjoyed the relaxed pace, never rushed. Relaxing meal!

column3: Eat steak like an old time gentleman
column4: Celebrated a friend's 40th birthday here and we all ate great steak like old timey fancy people in this historic steakhouse. I ordered the King's cut prime rib because I overestimated my abilities. It was incredible but I could not finish it. The juiciest steak of my life. The fat tasted better than a lot of other steaks. No one in the group had the mutton although that is their premier dish. I regret that. We all overate, drank bourbon, and felt like fat cats dining with Teddy Rossevelt.

I've eaten at Peter Luger's in Brooklyn, Ruth's Chris, Morgan's, Del Frisco's, Old Homestead and of course Keen's. In my opinion the top two are Keen's and Luger's. But since Luger's is in Brooklyn, Keen's is the best steak in Manhattan by quite a big margin. All of them (not sure about Luger's - its been awhile) pour melted butter over the steak. Keen's does not. In my opinion, that's cheating. EVERYTHING tastes better with butter. But Keen's does not. The taste is out of this world. Their ages steaks are properly marbled and cooked to perfection so you don't need the butter. My son requests Keen's for his birthday dinner every year. And we are happy to oblige. I also know that I can always accompany my steak with my favorite Lagavulin scotch and a nice big red wine. I like to finish it off with a nice port. Meals at Keen's are exquisite. And the pipes lining the ceiling are cool, especially when you have someone who works there tell you the story behind the pipes. I have no connection to the restaurant except as a customer who has been going here for at least 15 years. Best in Manhattan.

This is a steak and chophouse. Big, hearty portions and large perfectly cook steaks.  It's a busy restaurant at dinner time. It's a bit quieter for lunch. But, this is not a quiet romantic environment. It's fun! The pipes on the ceiling are cool and there is a strong sense of history and culture throughout the restaurant.  Service is good, like I said, its a busy place. And, yes, if you're pinching pennies this is not the place for you.

Expensive steak... but it‚Äôs very good ^ ^  Portion is quite big for an Asian like me! Suggest to order 2 steak to share with 3 people or else it‚Äôs either a waste or take away > <  Simple comment: it tastes GOOD and JUICY... it was the 2nd time I dinner there with the same colleagues which we all felt the steaks was good and yummy!
The steak was tasty but not up to my high standards of the last few steaks I‚Äôve had. Friendly staff and interesting atmosphere.

Six of us visited Keens to celebrate our friends 50th Birthday. We had all been there 5 years ago to celebrate mine and it was top of our too do list to repeat the experience. Some of us have been in between these visits and we're never disappointed. We booked the table 6 months in advance stating that it was a birthday celebration. The food as always was outstanding. Terrific steaks and the legendary mutton chop did not disappoint. However our table was just inside the entrance and we were freezing. We kept getting up to close over the curtain to stop the draught and try and keep the heat in. We asked the reception staff to keep the curtain closed however they left it open every time they came through it. We advised our server that we were cold but nothing was done about it. We also advised him that our steaks got cold very quickly and the sides were cold almost immediately. We did not wait for dessert as we were all freezing cold. It was only after we asked for the bill and complained again that the air con began to put out slightly warm air. It smelt very stale and dusty as if it hadn't been on recently. We were all very disappointed and annoyed that our friends birthday celebration was spoiled. We hope our next visit will be a much better experience.

Went here before our show on Broadway with some skepticism. It was excellent. Very cool authentic vibe and really great steaks. We had the 12 ingredient chopped salad to start. Then filet mignon and the king prime with creamed spinach and hash brown. We loved it.
Steeped in history the Mutton Chop is a ‚Äòmust‚Äô and the Prime Rib a close second. The Bloody Mary is so good you feel as though you could ask for a knife and fork !

This old classic steakhouse is better than ever. Real Prime Tenderloins are incredibly delicious. Don‚Äôt miss the Lump Crab Meat Cocktail. The perfect atmosphere and service makes you want to come back for more.
Excellent waitstaff, perfectly cooked filet and creme brulee. Great atmosphere and history. Reservations recommended.
This place was a very nice steakhouse and everything was perfect except the fast that my steak was more cooked than what i wanted.
Great steak restaurant in Midtown. Food and service was excellent, we shared a chateaubriand and it was lovely. Only downside was the tables for 2 were so close together.
Great food and great service. Met an awesome person from close to my home town! My wife had the prime rib and I had the mutton. The mutton was the best I‚Äôve ever had. Huge portion and fantastic!
One of NYCs steakhouses locates Midtown. Expect to pay around USD 100 per person. Quality of meet very good but I have to say that is not the best I ever had.
just far away enough from Times Square not to be a tourist-trap-steakhouse, this one is the real deal. Lively bar, restaurant across 2 floors and - most importantly - great steak. recommended!
American old style steak house, nice and cute meat cooked to perfection starters are top also. after finner there is z good selection of malt whisky.

just had the most amazing dinner at this restaurant on our last night in New York. Service was amazing, all the staff is very friendly, the steak just melted in your mouth. We can not recommend highly enough

I went there for lunch this time and still great!! The thick cut bacon was excellent. The salad with sirloin was tasty. They were very accommodating when I made modifications.
Place is nice. I love their steak and we came back! The staff are friendly and they gave excellent service. We will definitely come back again for more.
We booked this restaurant and so glad we did as really busy. Lovely atmosphere and food was amazing. Best steak ever tasted. Was a bit expensive but worth it
Been putting off going to this place for years. We finally made it and loved it. We had the Mutton chop and it was very good. Love the atmosphere and the service was very good also.

The meal here was amazing and the service was spectacular. However, the history of the restaurant is the entertainment. Employees were happy to chat about the various pipes on display. It's not cheap, but it's worth the memory.
A real treat. If you have time, do eat here. The food is excellent, the service is top notch. It is not cheap but good value for money.
The best steakhouse service was excellent, food was excellent. I never eat before like this. My meal was so tasty and steak was nice and hot . I will recommend this place. And I will come back soon
everything was just perfect. we were lucky enough to get a seat without reservation but with an hour wait but the place is usually packed. worth the wait.

column3: A classic and a big surprise
column4: An amazingly beautiful and historic setting with excellent food (and that includes wonderful seafood and fish as well as superb steaks and spinach) Add terrific service and a noise level that actually permits conversation. Not cheap but well worth every cent

Amazing it‚Äôs a real word for this place , I already came here at least 9 times and it‚Äôs one of the only places that each new time is better than before. Cool staff nice drinks and lovely meats. So see you very soon.
One more happy visit to Keens. And like all the other times, Keens and the staff delivers superb service and world class steaks. Always a pleasure to visit Keens.
Old school service and style. A delight! Steak perfectly seasoned and cooked. Take a step into old New York
The steaks are unbelievable! You have to try the Porterhouse and the Thick-Cut Smoked Bacon, if you like meat... you can't miss this restaurant!

column3: My go to place in NYC
column4: The food and service brings me back to Keens, visited on a busy Saturday night great atmosphere complimented the food and service. Can't wait to come back.

The atomshere here is wonderful pipes of many famous people and ceiling all many different styles of them for a least a century The food is delicious meat and fish even though it‚Äôs a steakhouse A great place to be Service can‚Äôt be beat
Such a rich history, excellent food and exceptional staff. Our first time in New York and first time to Keens - we can't wait to go back.

Went here for my 30th birthday and it was simply brilliant. Steak was cooked to perfection and probably the best steak I‚Äôve ever had. Great atmosphere and great service. Highly recommend.
Now I have a problem. The standard just jumped to the roof! I never tasted and experienced steak this good!!! Expensive but, let the meat do the talking.. Sarap!

Came here for my birthday dinner and it was amazing! The food, the ambiance, the service, everything had me wishing I lived closer! Perfect for special occasions but also saw some people looking dressed down so I think it‚Äôs a great place for anything!
Eaten all around the world and this was the best prime rib ever. So tender a baby could have eaten it. Will be back !!
Be sure you ask to sit on first floor as that is the floor with the pipes on the ceiling and character. Good menu‚Äîgreat steaks and wonderful desserts‚Äîkey lime was the best!

column3: Great traditional steak in old NYC atmosphere.
column4: We had a large group and were seated at a large table. Service was good, steak was excellent. We got a porterhouse for 3 and it was great. Chops are the specialty here. Bar scene was also good.
The steak was medium rare done as instructed and service was impeccable. No condiments needed for the steak and will make you craving for more :)
you start with a blue cheese cream where you can deep vegetable, simply fantastic. the meat is really good, creamy spinach as well. A place to come back

Porterhouse for 3 was as good as it gets. We started with the seafood platter, delicious. Ordered sides for the table, and all was excellent. Nice, but not overwhelming wine menu. Would definitely go back

Nice filet mignon, perfectly done..Lobster bisque was excellent. Cheesecake was a nice finish. Atmosphere was perfect. This was an anniversary dinner that did not disappoint. Service was wonderful. Waiter was very attentive, but not smothering. Nice attention to detail.
This ia one of my favorite steakhouses I have been too, from the appetizers too the filet mignon all terrific, and service was fast and efficient ..
I like keens love the vibe & atmosphere but ideal that they steak can be a little bit more seasoned. Sides need to be upgraded

Had a great steak at keens the vibe in the bar is great a few drinks before are meal then the meal and service was fantastic. The Fillet steak was great and my wife chose the chicken which she said was also fantastic.
Interesting place, fantastic food and well worth the cost. It gets very busy so recommend booking rather than turn up on spec.

Basically you need to try this dish. Absolutely unreal. That‚Äôs pretty much all I have to say except the whisky selection is pretty astonishing, oh and the staff are insanely helpful too. In New York? Well go already!!

column3: The best steak we ever had..

Another year and another fab anniversary dinner at Keen‚Äôs. Service always most professional and food is over the top!

Great service! Great atmosphere! Mutton was way more than expected! Go to Keens! We had a wonderful felet. Great house wine! They brought carrots, pickles and celery with blue cheese for free as app! Love this place!

Warm wooden nostalgic interior particularly when it's a cold autumn night. Welcoming. Service was efficient, truthful and efficient. Had a rather large and extremely tasty rib eye. Lives up to the TripAdvisor ratings. I'll be happy to return.
My husband had been recommended this restaurant & it didn‚Äôt disappoint- fab see & delicious food. Large portions so consider sharing - or not

One of the best steakhouse! I‚Äôm a steak lover and first time I tried keens and yes my steak was cooked and aged to perfection! The staff are polite and knowledgeable! My creme brule i was die for it! I will definitely come back soon
Incredible porterhouse aged properly and. Taste wonderful. Great key lime pie. Excellent and precise service.
Very good steaks & cocktails! Also great service. It wasn‚Äôt our first time but it was again a great experience and we‚Äôll come again.
Great atmosphere (watch the hundreds of pipes underneath the ceiling), good service, food was outstanding (Oysters and Chateaubriand for two)
Walked in looking for great food and we got it!!! Great time at the bar, drinks and service was very good. Amazing, next visit will definitely go.
A true steakhouse with all the trimmings. I like the space and how its laid out among two floors. Traditional all the way with the traditional costs of NYC.
The first experience on the evening we arrived in Manhattan. And that steak gave us a boast for the next 5 days !! Nice atmosphere and a great service.

We had a great steakhouse experience at Keen's. very good service. Had chateaubriand for two ( huge portion, enough for 3 or 4) especially after lobster bisque and with side of mashed potatoes. Everything was delish. Good wine list.

Had wanted to go here for sometime. I got a place at the bar (was dining solo) quite easily. The NY strip steak was huge - and really good. The place has a lot of heritage, and looks great. It's split over several floors.
Would need to book as always busy, an option is to eat at the bar, very quaint bar and excellent food, good customer service, I would like to return
Keen‚Äôs reputation speaks for itself. The low lights, the old school decor, the wide assortment of steaks, I still salivate if I think about it. Go!

Wait staff is great, Realy enjoyed the decor with all the pipes on the ceiling, We spilt our food, a wedge salad, great dressing and a steak cooked to perfection. Dessert, creme br√ªl√©e, a totally delicious meal, even the bread and butter.

column3: The most original interior and tasty cuts

Had dinner before a show. Service was amazing! Atmosphere very dark, taverny and very comfortable. We ordered a filet & shrimp entree with potatoes which was a perfect amount. Martini was made perfectly which doesn't always happen. Would highly recommend and will be coming again.
This is the best steak I have ever eaten We ate in the pub and wasn't disappointed Service was brilliant, atmosphere in the place is buzzing I can see why this is the best place to eat steak
Excellent food and service. The crowd is not as well dressed as it was many years ago. In my opinion dress is too casual for such an excellent restaurant, one of a kind place.

Went with some friends for lunch. Excellent experience. Would definitely recommend it. I know most of the well known NY steakhouse and this is definitely my favorite so far. It's not cheap but worth the money

We ordered prime porterhouse with medium well-done. Even if it was medium well-done, the meat was so though. And also, the service was not good. Generally, I felt a waiter is unkind. I don‚Äôt want to visit again.
What a great meal. Went with two work colleagues. Old school steakhouse that is excellent. Two of us had steaks and one had lamb. Would highly recommend Keens.
If an Alberta beef girl was wowed over her 8 oz fillet mignon , nothing else needs to be said. Service was top notch and the restaurant itself has such an interesting history. Pricey but so worth it.
Hmmm... Food was okay. Service could be so much better. A little arrogant! Ambiance is perfect! Will I recommend? Peter Luger in Brooklyn - much better for us.
Not the first visit and won‚Äôt be the last. Always great steaks served by great staff. For meat foodies this is hard to beat
Love this place Food and service always great. The ‚ÄúMutton Chop ‚Äú is to die for. Bring your appetite, portions are big , so share starters and sides. Also the decor is very unusual . Do not miss
Every Year when we visit NYC, we go the Keens. Absolutely Perfect. The Service, the Food, the Location & the Quality of the Meat. We Love Keens. For me, even better than Peter Lugers.

column3: The best of the rest Chop Houses
column4: Crowded busy noisy .... but the most amazing Lamb Chops I have had ever!!! It‚Äôs a place where New Yorkers go not for everyone if you are a tourist .... but this has to be it for the meat

We travelled all the way from the UK to have our 30th wedding anniversary meal at Keens and it did not disappoint. The food was amazing especially the chateaubriand. The glass of champagne on arrival was a lovely touch. I cannot recommend it highly enough.
We found this on Google maps in the garment district and boy were we surprised. We ate a Chateaubriand for two and we were pleasantly full with delicious food.
A group for dinner went with high expectations. Service was average food was okay but a bit expensive for what you got. A city like NYC has to have better steak houses
Very nice atmosphere, it seems quality steakhouse. It is. Steaks were nice but i did not like "mutton chop"

column3: One of the best steaks ever
column4: Great food and service. We loved it. For NYC and such high quality food this place is very reasonable on price. Make sure to try the lamb if you like it.
A reasonably good steakhouse with rather high prices. At the cost steak I would expected potatoes as part of the deal not c$10.00 more. Toilets were not very special.
Great service, amazing place full of history... Steaks are just superb. Thank You Keens see you next year!
We shared a filet and mashed potatoes and started with some oysters. Everything was delicious, service was great and ambience was delightful. Would definitely go back and recommend to others!
Obviously this is the place to go when in new york. We had the porterhouse for 2 which is $100 and the steak just melts in your mouth. Absolutely gorgeous!
In the heart of NY and very popular with all walks of life, from your 20s to 80s... The food was great and very reactive staff, for a place so busy there was always someone on hand.
Typical pricing for a. NYC steak house but much more atmosphere than others Service is great and food portions are ample Chateau Breaun for two could feed three or four Best steak we have had in NYC

I still believe that old school is still the way to go. When it comes to restaurants, even more so. This place is full of history in very inch of every wall. Great steak, wine list and atmosphere! Really liked it.

column3: Love the dusty pipes on the ceiling
column4: This place has a history - check the display when you check-in with your reservation. It also has great steaks. A classic NY steakhouse where you can't go wrong.

It was our anniversary and they gave us each a free glass of champagne. We had the chicken and the fillet. Both wonderful. the atmosphere and history of the place helped us enjoy our evening even more.
Very nice restaurant, very good staff and food was really tasty, i recommend it strongly for every person going to new york

We had the porterhouse for two - amazing! The meat was perfectly cooked, so tasty and tender. The restaurant is great - a typical steakhouse and staff is very nice! Quite expensive but definitely worth it. Will come back soon!
Excellent choice for first time visitors. Got 7pm Saturday reservations same day. 8 oz filet excellent as expected. Leisurely. Plan on $100++ per person

What a lovely place to find in New York. I love steak and am fussy about the way it is cooked. This place cooked it to perfection. Would definitely recommend going here very friendly staff and nice relaxed atmosphere.

column3: Great again! still good as ever.
column4: It has been a long time since I got to come back to this restaurant and was so glad to visit again. Once again, It was delicious as ever! Best steakhouse, great food, and wonderful service. You just have to try it.
We booked here under suggestion of a friend, and I will always thank him for that! We had the most delicious, juicy and soft steak ever! Worth every penny. Loved it!
great steak and new york experience and wonderful very historic place good service estimate $100 per person realistically
My wife and I have stopped in here again on a recent trip to New York. We always enjoy the food and the ambience.

attended a group dinner here and the service was amazing - Benjamin! Quick delivery for a very large group with tasty options and plenty of choices. The historical items on the walls were excellent to view and conversation starters.
Comfort and fancy mid town in NYC. I visited 2 times keens steak house. Love cream spinach, lamb and T born steak. Pretty expensive but mood.

So glad I chose this restaurant for my first visit to New York. The food was lovely and the service was great. They knew we were off to a show on Broadway and managed the meal brilliantly without us feeling rushed.

column3: Our annual stopping place for a great steak
column4: We usually make a point to stop by Keen's every time we visit NYC. We love the steaks and the atmosphere. Our kids always know that we will be having a great steak dinner when we visit the city.
Great dinning experience - the mutton was so delicious. The service excellent and a really unique decor.
Visit to Keens Possibly best fillet steak I have ever had.Fabulous ambience - traditional style Very highly recommended

World famous mutton chops. Great service and a wide variety of lunch options. The history of the restaurant is very entertaining. Smoking Pipes line the ceilings many by famous men. Definitely go. Great portions.
For lovers meat is amazing, place is very nice, very traditional, food very tastyfull. I really recommend this restaurant! Great steak house!

The porterhouse for 3 people was tender and spiced just right. Steamed veggies were perfectly combined. A rich chocolate cake for dessert was a good cap to the dinner. Interesting interior decor with smoking pipes adorning the ceilings!

column3: The best steakhouse in New York!
column4: Keens offer the very best steaks in New York. T-bone, prime rib, mutton chops, and more. Meat is very tender and very tasty. Service is good. Ambiance is unique. Make reservations.

Our meal at Keen‚Äôs was easily the best steak we‚Äôve ever had. Good sized portions, perfectly cooked and delicious sauces to match. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a great steak in NYC.

Went to Keens because it was close to hotel and got good reviews! I would say it is fantastic for nostalgia! The food was very expensive and just average! Service was excellent! If you want nostalgia it is two thumbs up! Food not so much.
Great steak cooked perfectly and very very tasty. The service was amazing and the servers were very knowledgable. Great overall experience!
Many people said Peter Lugers is the best. Been there many times, servers are rude. This place is as good as Peter Lugers and service is much better. I would come here again.

This was our third time here and is a must do for each time we visit New York. Great bar at the start then in for a great dinner, had the t bone excellent again. This is not cheap but it is superb food.
Had the Chateaubriand with my wife, it was delicious. The fries were phenomenal, not a single soggy one in the bunch. Expensive, but worth it.
Simply the best steakhouse in Manhattan, service unbelievable, steaks unbelievable side unbelievable, wine unbelievable appetizers on believable‚Ä¶ Need I say more
not cheap but what a steak - massive and absolutely delicious. excellent waiters who made up feel totally at home and an experience to remember

Filet and lobster were excellent. Service was as to be expected in a fine dining establishment. Very cool ceilings lined with old clay pipes and many signed by famous people on display. Walking distance from Chelsea area and Empire State

column3: One of the best in NY
column4: Goes without saying have the mutton chop, granted the steaks are amazing but you can have them all over. Lovely down to earth restaurant. Worth every penny #mutton
Outstanding meal - attentive service, delicious, well-prepared steak and seafood. Truly memorable meal. Expensive but worth every penny.
The Prime Porterhouse for two can be shared between three easily, with 2 sides. The meat is amazing, soft as butter. Service is great.

A very warm welcome. Lovely food, exceptional in fact. We asked for something suitable for our son and was given a child's menu. The service was great, the waiter was friendly and nothing was a problem. Highly recommended to couples, friends and families
We ordered pacific and Atlantic oysters. Four different steaks, sodas and couple of salads. It was high quality and had top quality family time.
Simply delicious. A no nonsense menu. We had the t-bone steak and the shrimps. Both were perfectly made.
Our third visit in as many trips and yet again Keens deliver! We had the Porterhouse and it was mouth watering! Service as always attentive. Will be back again on our next trip to NYC

We had a group of four adults and two kids. We really enjoyed the king's cut prime rib. We really found no fault with any aspect of the meal. It was actually not as expensive as we thought it would be. We would return.
Love the location and atmosphere. Very New York style, at least to me the Californian. Nice and knowledgeable bartender. Want to come back for dinner.

We visited here on the back of the Trip advisor ratings. We weren't disappointed. The food was absolutely first class as was the service. Yes, the tables are close together but this is due to the demand for tables here.
Probably one of the most delicious steak in New York! The staff and the chef are inncredibly professional. I will come back!!!

Whenever I visit NYC I always take in a New York steakhouse experience. This was the best I have had in NYC (or anywhere else in the world). The food,service, wine and ambience were exceptional. I arte this as a MUST DO
Great Steak and even better atmosphere, found the service good as we where travelling out the next day. Good wine list !!

What a wonderful experience and delicious dinner. Shared Prime Porterhouse and Mutton Chop cooked to perfection and succulent. Attentive service in authentic NY steakhouse atmosphere. Always a pleasure and hope to return.
Has Filet and Lobster both times and sat upstairs both times. What can you say that hasn't been said before? Great everything. Literally my new haunt in NYC.
I eat a lot of steak so I'm kind of hard to please. That being said I would still recommend this place. Their steak is good enough, the location, their service are excellent!

Consistently great food and service. Four people and the porterhouse for 3 was plenty . Wedge salad and side of mushrooms and creamed spinach finished the lunch!! Just remember the medium is rare anywhere else!

The best steaks ever, you could, and we did to prove it, cut them with a spoon. The atmosphere was great, wait staff excellent and the puddings followed suit. When we go back to New York we will go back for another try.
Outstanding service and very welcoming restaurant. The steak was very tasty and well prepared. Ideal setting either before or after a Knicks or Rangers game.

We booked keens in advance of our travel to NY. We ordered chateaubriand and it was absolutely cooked to perfection. We had great seats, the ambience was spot on and the service fabulous. If you love steak, you have to visit Keens.
I had a business dinner, hence I did not wanted to give the filet mignon back but it was totally overcooked and the same was the case with the spring vegetables. I clearly will avoid this steakhouse.

Known for their decor of churchwarden pipes, which neatly line the entire ceiling, and dark wood walls, Keens has exceptional food, notably steaks. Well prepared with shareable sides. Appetizers include salads and a raw bar. Service is top notch. Perfect for our anniversary dinner.
My husband and I were visiting NYC and wanted a great dining experience. The service was fantastic. T-bone steak and lamb mutton chop were cooked to perfection.
Had a fantastic dinner here, chateaubriand main following half a dozen oysters. Pricey but for NYC worth it with a great atmosphere and attentive service - well recommended!

Keen's Steakhouse has got an interesting history with a large collection of smoking pipes. The restaurant is dark and dingy. The service was excellent. The food was average. The price was very high. Interesting once but wouldn't return.

column3: Great steak and even better service
column4: Cannot fault this place - food was perfect and the staff were extremely friendly and attentive. 5 stars - cant wait to return

Really nice old world ambience and perfect service with really fine cuisine. Nice salads well served and beautiful quality steak cooked to your liking with good sauces and nice sides. Expensive but worth it.
Excellent food service and drinks f your looking to have a great steak and a great time this is the place
This used to be one of the greatest stake places in Manhattan. On the last visit I was rather disappointed, the meat quality was substantial worse than before, cut and portions rather strange.

column3: College drunks should be in the bar.
column4: College drunks and medium equals bloody rare? Oh and by the way we're out of prime rib 30 minutes after the order.
Close to the empire building. Had lunch in this restaurant, not too busy at the lunch time. A lot of pipes in the roof. Traditional style inside. Meat is good. Has 2nd floor.
Lamp Chops were cooked perfectly. Double cut large enough for 2. Wine selection good. Only negative was the cost of a desert = an entree

column3: Great steak and old school charm
column4: This is an old school steakhouse. Small menu but great steak. Live lobster tank if you want surf and turf. Carrot cake is made in house and is pretty darn good. I appreciated the decent priced wine as well. Their namesake wine was just fine.

This amazing steak house never disappoints. Juicy thick prime New York strip is cooked to perfection. The service is professional. The spinach side is tasty not too heavy or too creamy. The atmosphere is fun, the pipes on the ceiling add an original touch.
Amazing experience, excellent service and food! One of the few places I visited repeatedly and they offer the same quality of food and service! Consistency in everything they do!

They're still kicking it (as in they are still very good). As fashions change Keens relentlessly focus on traditionally exceptional steaks and chops in a cosy, dark wood, low, clay piped lined, ceiling. One of the top 10 dining experiences in New York.
One of the best steakhouses in NYC very good food and very friendly staff. we had the serf n turf and the mutton steak perfect!!

column3: King cut rib superb ....service not good.
column4: My rib was cooked perfectly ,side dishes poor and our waitress was not very friendly not what you expect in a restaurant with a good reputation like Kennes.Spoiled my dinner.
The king cut prime rib was cooked perfectly and was so tender and juicy. Outrageously good! Excellent service and a traditional NYC steakhouse atmosphere all add to a great experience.
Split the sirloin with my daughter, the best sirloin I've had in I don't know when, The housemade limeade was a big hit too!

placed our order, appetizer never came.Within 15 minutes of our arrival our entrees came. Server never came back until he brought dessert menu.My husbands second beer was not the same as his first. For the money, not worth it.
Great food and service! The atmosphere was really cool. Cozy and comfortable. Would definitely go back.
Steaks where great, not so the appetizer. Oysters Rockefeller with little taste and unappealing presentation. Mediocre wine list and loud. Not the place for romantic dinner. Service was ok.

column3: Steak Steak Steak - all you can say
column4: One of the best steaks that I have had. Just stopped in no reservations, service was excellent and staff was perfect. Even forgot my wallet and they let me leave and come back without a hassel. Great place to go.
Wonderful Steakhouse, I would rate them in my top 5. Steaks are done just like you ask for. Atmosphere is like stepping back into old N.Y. We will be coming back for sure.
First time to Keen's Steakhouse was not disappointing. Filet was outstanding. The pipes on the ceiling tell a great story from the past. Will be back next time in NYC.
Great steak, nice mood, good service and a wonderful decoration. Prepare your wallet if you would like to enjoy a whole dinner with some wine.

Spectacular place to eat, perfect environment to eat, drink wine and relax. The meet is unbelievable! We had the chateaubriand meet and the meet almost melted in our mouth. I definitely wanna come back every time I would be in NY!
Excellent food and service. Price reasonable for NYC. Place was very busy but the service was great. Nice ambience. We ordered steak, sole, lobster and shrimp and all of us were very pleased.

Yes. Simple as that. Great location, good atmosphere. The food is a league of its own. No words for the quality of the meat. I also loved the sides. Very nice and friendly service. Everything perfect here!

From the crudit√©s to the 32oz prime rib, my meal was excellent! Steak was perfectly cooked, waitress was very helpful and friendly. She also gave us the background or history of Keens very cool! Churchwarden pipes covered the walls and ceilings. Highly recommend this place!

Visited this restaurant on our honeymoon. The staff were very attentive and friendly and the food was tasty but expensive for what it was. Had it not been a special occasion I probably would have found somewhere cheaper.
Great place , great steak ( only 2nd to bs diner in South Africa) in my own experience. Pricey , but that's what you pay for , great service ! Classic place ... go and you will enjoy
Well worth a visit food is superb staff attentive. You need to book in advance as it's always busy take a couple of hundred dollars with you! It's expensive !

column3: Lives up to the great reviews
column4: Olde World atmosphere and great service. Food was served very quickly, sides and steaks were excellent. Desserts are huge and best for sharing! Not a great wine choice at reasonable prices, but good beer selection on tap.
Loved the steak very good and tender, juicy. Will definitely come back. The waitstaff is awesome as well. Love love love....

column3: Best steak I have ever had !!
column4: On arrival we were greeted promptly our server jimmy was great very attentive. I am Not a big steak fan it's my husband who is but I must say it's the best thing I have ever tasted ! Keep up the good work.
The Poterhouse for two was cooked to perfection. I really enjoyed drinking the Manhattan surrounded by all of the pipes. Service was quick and efficient, so no complaints.

Expensive. If we were forced to sit near the small table, we felt them too expensive. but our table was a little bit larger at this time luckily. Nice service, and I did not feel discrimination for steakhouse.
Keen's is what a steakhouse should be. Warm and inviting, you're going back in time to a more refined New York City when you walk in the doors.

column3: Delicious food in a cozy place
column4: Perfect lunch, very kind and polite stuff. Amazing steak! The restaurant is cozy, real New Yorker! Can't wait to go back!
Enjoyed the history of all the clay pipes. Pipes purchased and used by Teddy Roosevelt, Einstein, General Patton, etc.
Seriously the best seat house, traditional steak house for all tastes. Really enjoyed the food, atmosphere and service.
Dinner very good. Presentation excellent. Dessert ...... priceless!! The crime br√ªl√©e was best ever!!
I've visited all the top steakhouses for work and I can say this is really one of the best, but not the best. There's nothing to complain about here but wolfgangs is the cream of the crop

column3: Still one of my favorite restaurants in NYC
column4: I'm never disappointed when I eat here. I like to sit in the Pub Room. We usually go before or after a Ranger game have the Filet and Chicken Under a Brick. Food and service are always great.

For these prices, the steak should not be average! My son ordered the special Porterhouse, and it was just OK we are not likely to return. That said, the service was wonderful, and the pipe collection on the ceiling was very impressive.
Arrive by 5 and you will score a table in the small Pub room. Excellent cheeseburger and crabmeat salad. Ate there twice last week. Never disappoints!
Was walking around with a friend and we we willing to find a good steakhouse, well we have a very good pick. Staff very kind, food fantastic, atmosphere very typical. Go for it!

column3: Nyc break 2013, best steak in the world.
column4: Awesome place! Great atmosphere and decor with the biggest collection of smoking pipes I have ever seen. Unbelievable steaks I dont need to say anymore. Good selection of drinks and cocktails to go with the meaty menu!
The room is a delight, full of historic prints, with a collection of churchwarden pipes on the ceiling. I had the "Legendary Mutton Chop", a massive mutton chop. Delicious. Great service.
2nd time visited, just as good as the first. Largest steak I've ever seen! Ordered it as a medium but was more like medium rare but wasn't a problem, but might be worth bearing in mind.

Excellent hospitality here. Lovely ambience. Friendly, helpful staff and quite frankly the best fillet steak I have ever had!! Highly recommended Keens Steakhouse. In fact I would like to squeeze in another quick visit before I leave !

The meal was superb! I ordered the shrimp cocktail and T-Bone steak and both were delicious. For desert we had the creme brulee - also perfect! I highly recommend going to Keen's if you want a good steak.

column3: Best steak that I have ever had
column4: Best steak that I have ever had - Go here. You must!!! a bit pricey but then everything in USA is too expensive unfortunately

Excellent hospitality here. Lovely ambience. Friendly, helpful staff and quite frankly the best fillet steak I have ever had!! Highly recommended Keens Steakhouse. In fact I would like to squeeze in another quick visit before I leave !

Came here for a birthday dinner whilst visiting NYC and it did not disappoint. We shared the porter house for 2 with veg and mash sides with a peppercorn sauce, all delicious. We also tried some cocktails cosmo and mai tai- both really well made....More

What a difference 7 years make! I loved Keens in the old days but its not what it used to be (excepting the service remains excellent). Our supposedly "Prime" beef and mutton was questionable as evidenced by a decided lack of flavor and depth. Sides are so-so at best. If you are a tourist insist on dining in the main ground floor dining room or one of the side rooms. Sitting in the upstairs main dining room is like being stuck in steerage; I couldn't hear my family talk due to the gym-like cacophony surrounding us. Overpriced and overrated. If its steak you want you are better off at Pete Luger's in Brooklyn.

No wonder Keens is often listed in top lists as one of the best/iconic steakhouses in the United States. What a treat to mosey out of Times Square and on down a bit into this old world restaurant with little tables and dated d√©cor that is not at all pass√©. We are working our way through one of the aforementioned lists and this was our favorite so far.

The meal was superb! I ordered the shrimp cocktail and T-Bone steak and both were delicious. For desert we had the creme brulee - also perfect! I highly recommend going to Keen's if you want a good steak.

Not only was the food great, but it was a throwback in time with pipes on the ceiling from the 45,000 members going back to President Lincoln. After lunch we had a private tour of the well preserved rooms, which was like an archived museum. Fascinating dining spot and highly recommended for taking out special clients!

We came to keens as a present bought by friends who had eaten here previously with glowing reviews.  We had cocktails before being seating which were very tasty! (The Bloody Mary is defiantly one to try) We had a lobster starter also which was very nice indeed.  The main course however I am unsure if I ordered wrong but it was a little over facing. A 38 oz cut of rib eye which I eat about a quarter of. My friends recommended the steak to share for two which did look very nice also. My over half had a fillet which was cooked perfectly and tasted the same. When we visit NY again I would love to come back and try a different cut as I am sure I ordered incorrectly.  The wine list is out of this world - I've never seen one like it.

column3: Best steak that I have ever had
column4: Best steak that I have ever had - Go here. You must!!! a bit pricey but then everything in USA is too expensive unfortunately

Went to Keens whilst visiting New York and had the best steak and lump crab cocktail ever! The service was attentive and the ambience had a great buzz, glad I don't live here as I would be tempted to visit often and would inevitably pile in the pounds

column3: Sublime - best steak I've ever had!
column4: My partner and I ate here on a Sunday evening. The atmosphere was fabulous, created mostly by the eclectic interior and attentive service (look up at the ceiling and revel in the myriad of pipes!!) The food was incredible. My partner had the surf and turf (mignon + lobster) and I had the mignon. Luckily for him, even though I went for the smaller size, I could not eat it all and so he happily lapped up my leftovers. My partner is not prone to over-enthusing about food but as he tucked into his plate he uttered the words "I don't want to stop eating this" which was more praise than I've ever heard from him before! One word of warning, we attempted to order a portion of chips each, the waiter corrected us that one would be plenty and boy was he right!! We both had dessert, he the Key Lime Pie and I the Affogato. We also had a lower-end price bottle of wine but it was outstandingly good. The whole meal came to around ¬£100 per head and was worth every single penny
Keens is my fauvorit steakhouse in New York. Incredible good service every time. And the food is alway first class.
I had a great meal at Keens for lunch but even at lunch the sticker shock was in full effect. Seems like it would be a great special occasion place. Definitely get dessert!!!

column3: Great dinner - good place to talk
column4: Had an early dinner with my wife. We both able to hear each other - no background music! Food was excellent. My lamb chops were perfectly done and my wife chicken was delicious with rosemary leaves and very juicy flavored with white wine.

Had an excellent double Porterhouse for 6 persons at the second floor of Keens. Not exactly the same fantastic atmosphere than downstairs, but quieter environment. Cooking was just perfect and the Porterhouses disappeared almost as fast as they came to the table.

column3: Nice atmosphere, check out the ceramic pipe collection
column4: We went there for late dinner after a Rangers game and was seated promptly in the bar area. My wife had a Cobb Salad which was delicious and I had Turkey Schnitzel which was good, not great. A lively place with attentive service.
We enjoyed dinner at Keens Steakhouse and it was very deliscious! Good meat but also good other choices. It has something for everyone. A special hint: try the "Mai Tai" drink. Amazing!
Came back to Keens after a few years of not going there and the food was just as good as I remember. Great meat. Good wine list and unique atmosphere - you can't go wrong

This restaurant was very nice. The food, staff and the environment was absolutely perfect. We just went in without knowing this was one of the best restaurants in NY and was happy to get a table immediately.
Went with a large group of people. The atmosphere was truly amazing. Service and food was first class. Portions were large. Absolutely no complaints.

This restaurant is amazing for fine dining. The history behind the restaurant is unbelievable. The food is out of this world. Keep it on the down low because we want this to remain a local secret! Lol ;)
Wonderful steak.Nice decoration and friendly staff.We enjoyed our dinner but it was expensive enough--

The bar is great. The history of this place will just blow you away. The bartenders and servers are the best! The food is outstanding. The prime rib is unbelievable. This is my new favorite steak house.

column3: An Oldie but a Good Choice...Still
column4: We snagged a great pub room table & settled in by the fire to enjoy the basics - oysters rock, caesar salad, and the king's cut prime beef...all were spot on. The service was great too.

We had dinner here on the Sunday after Thanksgiving and it was amazing! The food superb and the service was beyond exceptional. It was an experience like no other and I would do it again in a heart beat.
Yearly visit to New York, and a meal at Keens is must. The setting is lovely, the staff efficient, and the food is delicious.
Everything was pure perfection - the service was fantastic, the drinks were delicious and the food was out of this world!
Went in Sept 2016 for my 25th Anniversary Meal. Food and service amazing and the best steak ever. If you like steak then this is the place to go in nyc.
Absolutely amazing, the T bone steak what can I say, big, thick, juicy, full of flavour! Great atmosphere, only sorry I couldn't eat it all, I'll be back!
Great service and excellent food. Loved the environment. Would have loved to have seen the whole restaurant. Maybe next time.
This is THE place to have Thanksgiving dinner when in the city. The menu was perfect. The service exceptional. The food was out of this world. We wouldn't have Thanksgiving dinner anywhere else.

Selected this restaurant based on reviews and its history. Although food and service was good, I expected better. Limited selection of steaks. My steak was slightly overcooked and the seafood salad would have been better with less dressing.
Best (and biggest) steak I have ever had by far, a must visit for any meat eater. Friendly staff and interesting decoration
Wonderful filet, creamed spinach (which I don't normally care for) and desserts. Gracious staff. Recommend reservations.
Fantastic Steak! Had Filet and Lobster cooked to perfection. Walking distance made it that much better. Very interesting decor made this that much better.

Last time I ate alone at the bar and had a great experience. This time I took a group of 6 for a business dinner. Service was excellent. Food was stellar. Wine list was great. Truly a great meal. Can't wait to return.
Best place i visited in NYC. The actual building, history and food was spot on. Can not complain about anything here!
I can not deny the quality of the meat, but I think it is very expensive. The atmosphere very noisy and the tables very close together, which does not allow you to chat. i would not go back
Great location and beautifully furnished. On our New York Trips it is a must for dinner! We recommend the porterhouse for two but also the filet mignon is worth! It is always worth a visit!

A great. classic, old school steakhouse. The mutton chop is worth the $$. Shrimp cocktail was ordinary. The wedge salad was excellent. Service was professional and consciousness. Warm rolls were perfect.

column3: Just had to try this institution
column4: we had a late booking , unfortunately a problem for travellers. and probably too late in the evening to enjoy the delights of a huge steak. Cocktail were delicious. the food deserving of it's reputation. the staff were tired but attentive

column3: new creation carrot cake with choclate sauce
column4: excellent surf and turf excellent hash browns excellent bloody mary bar art is a classic new creation carrot cake with choclate sauce was created 2 years at my request
Best steak we have ever had. Place is amazing as is the food and the staff. Will definitely go back when we're next in New York.
I eat at all NY's steakhouses frequently and I always got my best filet mignon here... nothing to compare !!

Had a meal here last night with two friends from Long Island, the food is amazing and the setting is fabulous. If you like high end food and wine look no further. The fish dishes look brilliant as well.

Booking recommend or you'll wait. But you'll understand why when you get your food. Steak cooked to perfection, fabulous wine and cocktails. What more could you ask for. Oh historic restaurant and attentive waiting staff .... You'll have that too. üòÄ
Best steak of my life. Exellent service and beautiful location. From oysters to the Wine chart... Absolutely unforgettable! Try!
Would highly recommend this steakhouse, the steaks are huge and taste fantastic. Service is great too.

column3: Mutton mutton, who's got the mutton?
column4: Go for the muttonchops. And since you're already there, add some carbs (creamy mashed potatoes) and fatty vegetables (creamed spinach). And top it all off with some mushrooms to boot. Worth the hype. Beautiful old-school ambiance. Always a pleasure.

Nothing to write home about. Staff was not very helpful and super slow. Restaurant was very stuffy. Uncomfortably warm with outside temps in the mid 40s. Steak was good but not very flavorful. $245 meal for two I expected to be blown away.
Great service - very efficient but not rushed. Enjoyed the artichoke then shared the porterhouse for 2 (among 3) which was delicious and well seasoned. Not a cheap meal but worth every cent.
Amazing food. Our night had a slight hiccup that was immediately rectified by the Maitre de who could not do enough for us. You must try this wonderful buzzing restaurant.
Totally my best restaurant by far in NYC. Great service, great food served in a nice decor. Staff are friendly. A classy and elegant decor

First of all we were packed with 11 on a table, this wasn't comfortable at all. Initially they said it was normal, after we kept complaining they did something about it. The steak was OK, but honestly have had better

column3: I will never eat a better steak
column4: First off this place isn't cheap, but I can't fault a single thing about it. The meat was cooked to perfection and so tasty. The service was attentive and they were helpful in choosing what to eat.
An OK meal, but not for the price. Lobster Bisque was good, but had pieces of crab meat in it, not lobster. $20 for the roasted vegetables.
Great steak, great wine suggestion, great service and interesting place with lot of history. More expensive than mid-range, but not too pricy and absolute worth it.
Nice place with lots of history, food is ok, but not to die for. Nothing extraordinary as I expected as this was rated high as NY steakhouse.

The history of the pipes makes this historic restaurant a place to see despite having dinner. However, the steaks are to die for and the cocktails are perfect! I've eaten at restaurants all over and this is definitely one of my top ten!

column3: Great dinner in the Bull Moose Room
column4: Had a wonderful opportunity to have a business dinner with eighteen colleagues. The staff and service were top notch and the food and wine was superb. Keens really does live up to it's reputation. Oh, and the old pipes are all very cool.
The story the history the character of the restaurant is enough to go there not to say enough about the quality of the food. We had a very delicious filet and lobster that we are still talking about.
Last night in New York and came here for dinner. We both had the fillet mignon with lobster and it was excellent. Great atmosphere with staff to match.

The place is very historic. The food was outstanding and the service matched. The steaks, mutton chop and prime rib all made for a meal to remember. Save room for desert, which was equally impressive.

column3: Had a way better steak in TX for half the price
column4: The atmosphere is very unique and cool, along with a very friendly waitstaff. However, my steak was not up to pair with any steak place in TX. Was not worth the price at all.
Great atmosphere and decor, with the thousands of pipes. Very good food and excellent service. It's not for no reason that Keens has been around for a very long time.

this is a very typical fine steak restaurant in Manhattan. Meat was wonderful and all expectations were fulfilled. Definetively a place were to go back with friends or clients in a relaxed atnosphere.
Fabulous place to visit, the food is stunning, the service is great and the building and surroundings are truly wonderful.
Visited on the 3rd of October. The lobster bisque for starters was very tasty and the fillet Steak was cooked to perfection. Overall great meal however it is on the high price so be aware.
Definitely a place to go if you are looking for great steaks!. Make sure to reserve a table ahead because is crowded at dinner.

A meat-lovers paradise. Great back story, really good service. A large menu. The cocktails were generous. We had one of the best Porterhouse steaks and side dishes. Desert was really good too! So fun to take guests.
The localization of The restaurant is very central. For lunch it was very good. Lobster salad was very delicious. Fleminyon was alsa very good. The service and Staff was very good.
Service atmosphere and food were all excellent. This is my 4th visit, and I am yet to be disappointed.

They have a huge collection of church warden pipes, and you'll find them on the wall's and ceilings in some rooms. They even have some that belonged to famous people. The food was great, albeit a bit expensive. Id recommend a reservation.

This is an old school steakhouse - the kind that make you wish you had dined here a century ago when it was state of the art so that you could have a better appreciation of the history of the place. Great food and service!
My hubby and I have just enjoyed a gorgeous steak dinner in Keens. It was cooked to perfection and extremely tasty. Friendly and great atmosphere. Worth every penny to have a steak of this quality.

Top notch steakhouse. Excellent cuts of beef prepared just as ordered. We were massively overdressed. Weird since dinner for two can easily exceed $300. Service was good but not great. No complaints about the food. Desserts need an upgrade. Coffee we excellent.

column3: The biggest steak you will ever see or eat in your life
column4: In summary, Keens is a must for anyone willing to fork out for the steak of their life, in a historic, quaint chop house which has an old-worldly feel to it.
Authentic atmosphere with attentive and sincere service that makes the menu even more mouth watering. The food is fantastic. Keens is the best.
Can't wait to come back here! I loved the fact the placed has changed so little over the decades. A must visit if you are meat eater.
Just as the title says, amazing porterhouse, great ambiance and service. I would definitely go back to this place next time I'm in NYC.

column3: We have been coming here and enjoying this delightful restaurant for many a year !
column4: This time around my son had his after marriage family dinner at Keene's and everything was perfect. Thank you Keene's for being my favourite restaurant in NYC and also my childrens. And soon I expect my grand childrens also :-)
Great for a group of friends but not for a quiet meal. Steak did not bowl us over, had better food elsewhere. Had to send our steak back, it was not medium.

My wife and I were jammed into a table between two tables with 4 people on each side. Only exit was between our table and theirs. Spent 176.00 and while the portion was large the flavor was below average.

One of the best steak dinners we've had anywhere. A tremendous restaurant experience all around, from the smoking pipe decor to every bit of food and drink we tried. Be advised - it's not cheap. But no great steak meal ever is.
As a Belgian I like some good Meat. At Keen's you get the best of it. Good service (magnificent waiter), good food AND Belgian beer ! We had the porterhouse for two and gosh ... the best steak ever.

column3: Good place for a good meal
column4: We called here on the off chance and were not disappointed complimentary appetizer and a wide choice of well cooked food. Would certainly recommend for a treat .

We ordered a porterhouse for 3 and 2 8 oz filets and were not disappointed. Portions are generous and service is good. Starters (crab cake and tomatoes salad) were not as good as the main. Nicely decorated with old pipes everywhere on the ceiling.
Food done very well. Service fine. A very nice experience. The Prime rib was as good as I've ever had!

Easily one the best meals of my life. Had the shrimp cocktail, the lobster bisque, the t bone and mashed potatoes. The whole meal was great. My friend recommended the bloody Mary's which I would have never thought to get there. They were amazing.
Great evening with perfect service. Wines and beers perfect, the waiting time of 30 minutes in the bar ran through like nothing. Food was perfect, steaks like butter. Loved it!

We had dinner there during a recent trip to NYC. The service, first at the bar and then at our table, was wonderful! The food was excellent! Champagne was delivered to our table because it was our anniversary. We will definitely return.
Went here with my family and weren't disappointed. Lovely decor and fantastic meal with great service. Thanks and we will see you the next time we are in NYC.

Plan on paying for the service, atmosphere, and quality but well worth it. We will be back. Nice to have a well lit and not too loud of a place to share a great meal with the family. Very cool history too.

This is yet another institution in The City. For some reason I prefer the chops here, but not because the steaks aren't just as scrumptious. You can't go wrong no matter what you choose at this place.

column3: One of the top steak houses in NYC - great food, wine list and charming setting
column4: It doesn't get much better than Keens. Porterhouse is fantastic. Mutton chops are very unique. Thick cut bacon is incredible. This is an old school steakhouse at its best.

We ended in this steakhouse without a reservation, but they were able to accommodate us nonetheless. Service is flawless and decor is one of a (nice) kind. The steak I had was superlative, the hamburgher was OK. A decent wine list completes the picture.
Very high class restaurant , food service atmosphere . Excellent meat and a large wine selection . Amazing food
I had to try this classic New York institution. The service is excellent and I had the prime rib which was cooked to perfection. The house wine is very drinkable and reasonable at $10 a glass.

column3: Best Steak I have ever had.
column4: Fantastic Food, on the expensive side but well worth it, mouth watering cant wait to come back to new York for Keens alone. Keep it up.
Service was impeccable! Food amazing! Like going bk in time to Mad Men or Sinatra times!!!‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è Well worth the price! Guy had the mutton special - looked amazing!

column3: Great Food, Great Service and Great Ambiance
column4: We had a family outing to NYC to see shows and museums. Going to Keen's has become a tradition and importantly expectations were exceeded.
We had a really enjoyable time. Good food and service in an interesting and historical environment. My son was really fascinated by their pipe collection (and I have to admit I was too!)
First time having lamb, very good.. Loved the pipe collection.. Filet was so good.. Had lobster bisque.. Solid.. Would recommend.

We where to long shopping and found this place by accident and we where amazed by the super tender chateaubrion, it was also the biggest ever served in front of us. sevice was great gladly the know it to becauce they diduct the tip anyway.

column3: Best steak ever, I really believe it may be
column4: Once a month we just want a great steak. This was it! Super service. Special atmosphere and history. Will go again next time in the city for sure.
Came here based on recommendation of a friend and the great reviews. Was extremely disappointing. While the service was fine, $60 for a tasteless T-Bone. Never Again!

Very nice steak with a good Caesar salad. Good atmosphere with good music but a little expensive for this type of food: steak and salad. There are other options that I did not prove and seems to be very good.

The porterhouse for 2 was huge, we also ordered lobster which was also huge. All perfectly cooked and quality meat and fish. Service was excellent - professional and helpful. Hard to get into but worth it if you get a slot.

column3: One of the best in New York
column4: Have been going to Keens for years every time I go to NYC. Consistently excellent steaks. If you are two people, go for the porterhouse for two, you can't go wrong.
I've eaten at all the great NY Steakhouses many times. However none have anything quite like a Keens Mutton Chop. Worth it a few times a year to satifiy that lamb craving.

column3: One of my favorite Steak House's in the City
column4: One the best steaks in the city. Love sitting at the bar or in the upstair dinning rooms. Their fresh ginger ale is the best... sometime it's not on the menu, so ask.
Great steaks, fast efficiency service. Ask for half portions of you add vegetables or share for two people. With a class of wine, starter, steak and side expect to spend at least $110-120 per person.
For someplace as expensive as keeps you expect them to get it right. Service was slow- I was hoping for more. Several mistakes I don't think there staff were all on the same page.
Che food was very good, che best meat i've eaten in NY ad well as the waiters,always kind and availble ,but che prices are too high even for a big city such ad new york
Wonderful food, great service,excellent fish and steak. Excellent wait staff. The atmosphere was so old world and quaint.
To give you the heads up my 8oz fillet was $57. the food is amazing but allow for about $100 each. we were taken out for a meal for my birthday so didn't see the bill for the 4 of us.

column3: The best steaks I ever had!
column4: So it's pretty simple, you need to order the Mutton chops and the Porterhous. Don't come alone and make sure you try both cuts!! Big cuts, no real need for side dishes etc... The best steakhouse in NYC for sure! Enjoy, E.
The steaks were very good. Sides also but the portions were small compared to other restaurants. Atmosphere and service is very nice.

We had the Porterhouse for two and it was fantastic. This is a very traditional steakhouse with exceptional service and food. There is a lot of history here and the overall experience is very enjoyable.
Great service despite it being a busy Fathers Day. The chateaubriand was fantastic and although we couldn't finish it due to the quantity, the quality certainly never suffered for it üëç
The dry aged meat at Keens is superior to their competitors in every way. The service is consistently great and the sides are sublime. For a genuine steakhouse experience this cannot be bested.

We were taken here by friends and were so pleased with our entire evening, the restaurant and decor is really cool, service was excellent, I had the famous mutton chop and it was delicious and well cooked, would highly recommend

One of my very favorite steakhouses. Love the atmosphere and the food. They didn't quite understand we had limited time and we were a little disappointed in how long it took to get served and to get the ck.

column3: Birthday Treat - This was a Treat and a half!
column4: Treat meal, fabulous staff, great venue with a very welcoming and warm atmosphere, just remember to take a look around at the walls and ceilings when you're done.
Perfect Filet Mignon. We had a bit to wait for our table, very croudy! (Guess due the holiday season). Nice and authentic interior - the whole cealing on the upper floor is full of old pipes!
Stumbled across this gem and meat was fantastic and in general food and service great. Only thing would be to have a better selection of wine by the glass.
We have had really good diner in Keens Steakhouse! The please is very characteristic and nice! Very good service and food quality ! The long list of wines is very appreciated !
We had a fantastic meal here with old school service. This restaurant represents the essence of new york and although a more expensive option still affordable for the overall excellent experience.
We enjoyed a great meal at Keen's. The atmosphere is great, the staff are very solicitous, and the food is outstanding. Highly recommend!
Good food, GREAT service! However, loud boisterous children behind me completely ruined my experience. Wish they had been asked to move.
The atmosphere is nice and traditional, service was great! We had the T-bone which was huge and tender as well as the Arctic Char which was delicious! It was a great location near our hotel.
This is definitely a treat night out, but really worth the extra cost, the best Bloody Mary l have had and fabulous food and service!
Great staff and the food is even more delicious. Will definitely be going back! And definitely recommend
Old fashion steakhouse We had the porterhouse for 2 and the wedge salad Went on Friday night and without a reservation and manager found us a table in about 30 minutes Great food and service

Came here for our 10th wedding anniversary after recommended by a friend & were not disappointed! The service was excellent & food amazing. The prices are higher than others near by but you certainly do get what you pay for
It's good. Very good. Actually, you won't find anything to complain about. Even if you have an extensive international experience as I have. No complains, I've just seen better places. Solid 4 stars.

column3: Best and oldest Steak house in New York
column4: After hearing Nookie Thompson (Broadwalk Empire) refer to Keens Steak house as the best we decided to try it. Very nostalgic and the Steak was to die for. What a piece of Beef mmmmm
I have eaten here several times on my trips to USA/NY and it never fails to meet expectations. Traditional, well prepared meats and a great ambience
Bonkers ambience, helpful staff a truly unique restaurant in good easy location. Food stunningly good - one of the very steaks I have had - strongly recommend this little bit of England in Manhattan.

column3: too young to rock too old to die
column4: too narrow between tables, low ceilings which, incidentally, would need a good cleaning. Meat is ok, otherwise it can be expected much more of a restaurant in this price range
Food and service was excellent. Sat in the pub side which is first come first serve if you don't have a reservation. Highly recommend the 12 oz prime filet.
To die for steak. A must when in NYC Historic place with great menu otims & service. A fab wine list too.

What a fun place. It has the largest collection of hard clay churchwarden pipes in the world all throughout the restaurant. Food and atmosphere was great. Steaks were perfect. Desserts were huge and fantastic.

Treat myself better before heading home, found this nearby restaurant after reading reviews here. Agreed on delicious steak, especially lobster bisque, yummy! However, one or two servers upstairs have room to improve on services; otherwise, services in general is pretty good.
Delicious steak and sides. Everything perfectly prepared. Enjoyed the crudit√©s and bread served first. We shared a sundae - wonderful end to the meal.
Great Steaks, Chicken and Mutton Chops! Also it is a really cool old New York Steakhouse with Pipes on the wall smoked by many famous people even old US Presidents
This place is an absolute must for steak lovers everywhere. I will be visiting again. It served our group the best steak any of us ever had...EVER!
