I've eaten here twice and enjoyed it both times. You know what to expect. Great (huge) steaks and traditional steakhouse sides. The wine list is really good and prices great for midtown NYC. Good fun, stepping back in time.

column3: One of the best in NYC
column4: Classic NYC steakhouse, with great history, and atmosphere. This is where to go to get that old school NYC feel, while also getting a fantastic steak and meal. Most of the newer NY restaurants don't have the charm and character of this place.
One of the best places we have been meat, excellent attention, very comfortable, the best meats and even desserts, excellent.   must be booked in advance
What else can I say - THE steakhouse you wouldn't like to miss. Nice service, exceptional food (and wine). Without any reservation after a short drink at the bar we still were given a table.

We went here to celebrate a birthday and can't thank the staff enough; the food was amazing. The lady serving us was exceptionally helpful; she gave us tips on places to visit and even gave me a free slice of birthday cheesecake. Definitely recommend!
Very enjoyable. Good food. Great service. Unbelievable history associated with this spot. If only walls could talk...

column3: A fantastic New York institution. Great dining experience.
column4: Great food, great service, great atmosphere, great amount of money... worth every penny. Nice and cozy with comfortable seating.
Would highly highly recommend to all as a must try! Bacon starter is best starter I've ever had and the steak was to die for. Service excellent also! A must for all!
The meat (in general) in this place is amazing. The service is very good. Doesn't matter which type of meat you order, for sure it will be very good so order the one you like the most.

column3: Mutton chops are nothing to write home about
column4: We specifically went to Keen's because of their mutton chops. Four of us were not impressed. Other than that sides and appetizers are tasty and service is good. Decor is pretty unique as they have hundreds of clay pipes on the ceiling.
They are famous for their Mutton Chop. Fantastic. I devoured the whole thing. It was just amazing. Dont forget the delicious chocolate cake.

Keens is the best steakhouse in New York. Anyone who tells you otherwise is mis-informed or doesn't appreciate New York style steakhouses. I've eaten here dozens of times and have never had a bad meal. Mutton Chop and steaks are both winners in my book.
Went here with my wife as part of our 10th wedding anniversary weekend in NYC. Highly recommended. The steaks were perfect if a little pricey, but hey, it's Manhattan :-)
Went here for my birthday and had a fantastic meal, service was great and it was a neat experience in the restaurant. Ask your server about the pipes and you will get a great story.

column3: Amazing steaks in a historic setting
column4: Excellent filets and Porterhouse and sides. Chocolate cake, cheesecake and cr√®me brulee were delicious. Service was attentive but unobtrusive. The restaurant has the ambiance of a 19th century gentlemen's club with hundreds of pipes displayed on the ceiling and warm wood.
I've had the NY Prime Rib King's Cut and it was huuuuuuuuge. Lovely atmosphere, very friendly staff and good food. Highly recommended...
We dropped by for steak lunch and tried their oysters half dozen for appetisers. They were delicious. However price was on the high side.
Gigantic stake, and i was proud just to be able to finish it. Great environment and outstanding service. Will definitely be back next time

column3: Everything I Fantasize about a NY Steakhouse
column4: Old New York history and residual ambiance a ton of style and texture in the surroundings to match the incredible cuisine. Steak servings are huge, bursting with flavor, etc. etc. Everything I could want...it exceeded This is the definitive stop
Terrific experience , amazing steaks, great service, it was not cheap but as it was a special celebration for my wife if did not matter. Around ¬£90 per person.
Its a great place. Everything positive. Athmosphere and setting. Food great. Service very good (loved the carrot cake plug = same recepie for 90 years!)√æ Great place - great choice.
Excellent Porterhouse for two! And key lime pie was a nice touch to birthday dinner. Only negative comment is I asked for a doggie bag for leftovers and the bone but never got it.
We had an incredible porterhouse, service was friendly and efficient, nice wine list, great cheesecake... would definitely go back!
Several bars, great history and food. We ordered the Tbone and shared between two due to large portions. Wine selection is vast. Very good service. Recommend

Excellent environment (classic chophouse). Great food (loved the fillet and mashed potatoes). Service was great. We had to go earlier than our reservations and they were extremely accommodating. Will return!

Great atmosphere, tons of history there. The food was amazing! We had the porterhouse for 2 and spinach & mashed potatoes & cheesecake. All were amazing! This is a must try, but make sure you book a reservation or you'll be waiting a while.

Its a most for steak lover. I had the T-bone steak and it was very good! the porterhouse is also very delicious. Some could consider it expensive, but the food quality, the service and everything worth it! I recommend :)

This restaurant is a most for the steak lover. The filet was out of this world and the porterhouse steak was also very good. The atmosphere is very nice. A little pricey but worth the food quality. a great place
Great place, great service, great food. The place was fantastic. There was a queue but they got us a table. Great steaks!

column3: Old school steak house in Mid town
column4: Keen's is a fun, old school steak house, where the waiters have been there since before you were born. It's pretty basic, no fuss, but serves good steaks and sides, good classic desserts.
Diner on the day of the Superbowl. Of course the setting of this restaurant is fabulous, the service was great, but the food was not to my high expectations and earlier experiences. Next time better?
We came here for lunch. The food was delicious (we shared the chateaubriand) and the chocolate mousse was excellent. We'll be back the next time we're in New York.
Very enjoyable meal at keens. Good service and good size portions. Would definitely recommend and would return

Went to Keens for early dinner before evening Broadway show. Three of us shared bone in ribeye which was cooked to perfection. Service was a bit spotty at moments but overall we had wonderful evening.

column3: If you want good meat this is the place
column4: Traveling on my own I found this place close to my hotel. Great service at the bar. Good selection of meat and good beer. The guy at bar knows how to do his job.
Back after some years in this historica steak house in nyc, established in 1885. Excellent meat ; fillet, porterhouse, t bone, really well cooked. Recommended
The steaks were fantastic. Service was good. Beers were not very cold but mixed drinks were very good. Would definitely go there on another visit.
Porterhouse with spinach and fries is a must have .... Expensive but worth it ! Doggy bag to take away what we couldn't eat ! Great atmosphere

Really wanted to try some good steak and could not have found a better place. I ordered the T bone and I was so stuffed that i actually decided to walk in the cold to my friends house which was a good 10 streets away.
Top class in every way . It just feels like old new york. Food was very good ,steak excellent . Just a nice relaxed feeling

This is a great steak house. I love it when a restaurant brings you a salad tray when you sit down. Our server was very attentive with attention to detail. The food was very good and would definitely go back.

Dined here on our first night in New York. Food was good but not amazing. Service was excellent really very attentive. If you're after a good steak it does deliver. However at these prices there really is better options. The overall experience just lacked

A place very valued, but without reasons. The meat is good, but nothing exceptional, except the high price. If you want to eat good meat, try a Brazilian or Argentine steakhouse, the cost benefit will be much better.
The best place to have lamb, ask for the Mouton , even there is a stake restaurant the lobster is very good! Is the oldest restaurant in ny the decoration is very nice all the smoke pipe

The sirloin steak was absolutely perfect. Thw waiters were very friendly. Nice choice of wines by the glass. Very good chocolate dessert. The soup was medium...But on the bottom line, this is definately a great steakhose. Better than Peter Luger? Probably not, but still great.

This place is absolutely awesome! GREAT service GREAT food GREAT surroundings! It is a little expensive but it is a gourmet restaurant, so you would expect that! Go try it out! You will not be disappointed!
My mother-in-law recommended it for our wedding anniversary last week and we were not disappointed. Charming knowledgeable staff, food fit for the gods and a stylish interior.

column3: Prices for the States but worth it
column4: Been to the US a few times and each time I go it just seems to be getting more expensive to eat out. This place is quality, great service and quality and menu is well worth going for

column3: Oldest restaurant in New york still outstanding
column4: Famous since the late 1800's for their mutton chop. Still on the menu, but they actually bring you a wonderful saddle of lamb. Busy place, get reservations, Kept beautifully, largely a local crowd. No bargain, but worth every penny. Couldn't be better !

Did my research before visiting NYC. Great place for amazing steak. Very happy teenage sons. Great ambience with real historic New York feel. Cannot go wrong if looking for the best. Pretty expensive but worth it
The steak is very good, but not cheap. A steak plus a glass of red wine will cost around USD 48.00. It is worth to go if you want to eat a good meat.
Excellent. I don't think steak gets much better than this. I think I may burst I'm so full üòÄüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüëçüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ
First visit to Keens, but wont be our last! Top of our steakhouse visits when we are in New York - wine selection was superb!
Not a lot to say except this is the best steak house in NYC.. Amazing atmosphere, incredibly helpful staff and mouthwatering food. Will 100% be returning on our next trip to NYC
melt in your mouth steak! Loved it. Great staff and service, but those steaks.... they take the cake. YUM!!!
The service & food were amazing and is definitely one of my best steak experiences. I had the filet mignon and my fiance had the prime rib. The portions are great and the ambiance is exceptional.
Really fabulous steaks here. We have a variety on our table, but the Porterhouse was especially good. The extensive wine list may be a little too extensive!

column3: Not much more I can say....
column4: Best steak ever! Although we had to wait for our table that we had originally booked, the food more than made up for it! Good atmosphere and great selection of wine. Not cheap but definitely worth the value.

A NYC institution that you don't want to miss ! The meal was outstanding & be sure to check out the historical bit about the restaurant --> thousands of antique smoking pipes affixed to the ceiling..... simply incredible -
I hope to had a better quality on the Filete Mignon, but it was quite poor. There are many restaurants in the city with better steak quality. Also, the restaurante is slippery, quite dangerous...

Went here after reading the reviews and seeing it on TV. Awesome steak, crabmeat appetizer, wine, dessert. Nothing here is cheap, but I cannot wait to go again. Even on a rainy weekday mid afternoon , it is best to make a reservation.
Good place for a business lunch or dinner. I would also consider this place for a nice steak with a partner.
Beautiful beautiful place, good service....excellent lamb! Stake (altough I expected it to be tastier) was also good and jucy. I recomend the place, definetly worth a visit!
Great food, knowledgeable and attentive staff. Hostess sat us promptly. Asked and was given a round table.

Had a fantastic meal here: best steak I have ever had and my wife agreed also. Great atmosphere, a gem of a place and will be returning the next time we return. Everyone and anyone who likes steak should consider this their no.1!
Very good meal. I liked the ambiance. Steak was really good. Sides were good, not quite great. Would return though. Great location.

Unbelievable food! Mutton and chops and steaks were cooked to perfection ! The ambiance of the restaurant was very interesting and unique! We purchased pipes for a remembrance of our visit! Looking forward to returning!

We always visit this historic steakhouse . We have never been disappointed and always enjoy the food quality and atmosphere. Seems to be visited by a lot of business people which is usually a good sign. Highly recommended.
This restaurant is quite expensive however you get what you pay for and the standard of the food is incredible. The staff were very attentive and helpful.

My husband and I had a late lunch at Keen's during a trip to NYC. Since the reviews were great, we expected to be served a wonderful meal. Our meals exceeded wonderful and we can't wait to go back again!
The best steak we have ever had.. Service, food and ambience was faultless.. When your in NY. This is a must.. We will definitely be returning
Keens Steakhouse was all we'd hoped for and more. Great service and a porterhouse steak for two to die for. Not forgetting the exquisite marguerites. Thank you
One of the best and most historic steakhouses in New York, fantastic food, great service and really interesting history, well worth a visit, book in advance.

column3: Great, historic atmosphere with amazing steaks and service!
column4: Massive , delicious steaks. We were with a group and had our own room. Fantastic experience. 90,000 pipes decorate the ceiling.
Made reservation for early afternoon which worked out great. My daughter said her fillet was the best she had eaten. Nice atmosphere. We stayed in Times Square so we walked to restaurant.
It's a visit worth. The meat is great, the service really good and the decoration fits the concept. If you need to wait for your table, the bar is the own bar is perfect for it.
very traditional steak house surroundings, good service and a very nice steak. The sides were also very good. overall a very good experience. Highly recommended.
I was taken to Keens Steakhouse for my Birthday .....Wow a Surprise ...Great steak ...great atmosphere ...Gee Best Day ...Thanks for Everything ...will be Back ...NYC IS SPECTACULAR...
Expensive but worth pushing the boat out for a special occassion, Excellent bar staff, nice atmosphere, interesting style and history.
Great atmosphere in a very cosy restaurant. Waiters are nice and work at a high service level. I enjoyed the Traditional Lamb - it was good and in a good portion!
We have been here several times and never been disappointed. Food is great. My wife and I split the T bone. They will slice it for two. It's the best steak ever. Great for a special celebration.

Been here a couple of times now. The food is to die for, surroundings are interesting, historic and comfortable. Staff are pleasant and friendly. Ok, it is pricey but no more so than other high end steak houses in NY. Highly recommended.

If you love Steaks, this is one of the best in NY, the quality is first class, the service is really good and the place decor is like going back a century in time. Ask for the porterhouse medium rare and you can¬¥t go wrong.
This is our second time to keens. If you love your steak, you need to visit here. Delicious steak but you pay for it. Our waiter was lovely and attended to our every need.
THis is THE classic Steakhouse, extremely historical! Conveniently located by Macys and Madison Square Garden. If you cant get a reservation, try the "Pub"... same menu. The "Bar" is classic too!
I went for dinner with my cousin we had a few beers first in the bar which was very sociable.and then had a great fillet of beef.
Probably the best steak that we have ever had, the porterhouse steak for two! Not cheap but well worth a visit for the experience!
the food is good, the steak was over done, but the marinate and the taste is really good, the extras and side orders are really good and a large variety of options,
Front the name and the outside I wasn't expecting anything other than a good steak but the restaurant is quite upmarket inside with lovely food and good service would definitely recommend

column3: Best steak I have ever tasted
column4: Fab restaurant, perfect steaks, great atmosphere. Quite expensive, but worth it for a special occasion. I had the fillet mignon - amazing and cooked to perfection. Loved this place. Would recommend booking in advance. Enjoy.

column3: The best steak I've had in a long time!
column4: We wanted to have a good steak during our visit to New York and were not dissappointed! I would definitely recommend Keens!
Classic New York steak house. Great old school vibe. Get the mutton chop be happy. Such a killer vibe. Can't wait to go back.
Keens has a great chop house feel. Excellent filet and halibut for main courses. Variety of salads and sides. Also delicious desserts.
In our opinion Keens Steakhouse has excelent food and service, the place has NY stile, we would go back for shure on our next visit to NYC.
Lobster bisque was average. Oysters were nice. Steak cooked to perfection but not much steak taste. Service was good. Remember to book if you want to dine there.

Fair attitude at host desk. 21 club better ceiling than a bunch of pipes. Meat perfect. Service cold. Been to--gallagers, Ben Benson, peter lugars, York, Smith and willingly,Ruth's Chris, et. al. All returnable!! Not keen.
Keens is a great place for a business occasion. And my octogenarian mom love it, too. Show up early and soak up the ambiance in the bar.
What a perfect steak!!You will love it and never forget it!! New York City must go place for good steaks. And the location wonderful!!
First visit to New York and my son arranged our meal. Food perfect, wine sublime, service incomparable. Can't wait to return.
We had a lovely meal but the server couldn't be bothered and commented that he'd 'had a long day'. We had the chateaubriand and it was delicious.

column3: Second visit - just as amazing as the first!
column4: Once again, Keen's did NOT disappoint. Amazing atmosphere, service, steak, side dishes, etc. You name it - Keen's executes it flawlessly! Definitely one of my can't-miss restaurants when I visit NYC.

If you're staying at The Strand Hotel on W 37th St, this place is literally around the corner and serves huge, delicious steaks. Good idea to book as was quite busy when we went - pricey, but well worth a visit.
I have been to a lot of steakhouses but this one stands out. My wife and I were in the city to see a show for our anniversary and we went here as well. What a great experience.

I have eaten steaks all over the world and this is right up there with the best of them. The overall experience at Keens was first class. The service, food and wine were all excellent. If you are in New York City then Keens is...More

If you're staying at The Strand Hotel on W 37th St, this place is literally around the corner and serves huge, delicious steaks. Good idea to book as was quite busy when we went - pricey, but well worth a visit.

We visited here during our recent trip to NYC and thought the food and service were both excellent. Yes it is expensive, however the steaks were large and seasoned to perfection so worth the price. We found our waiter to be very attentive, yet discrete. Water and drinks were topped up promptly. We would certainly recommend this restaurant.

Came here with the group of friends and was looking for a steakhouse that was a little bit different than the typical corporate steakhouse what a great surprise excellent food reasonable costs for New York City and more food than a dinosaur could eat I think my prime rib was estimated by the waiter to be over 30 ounces I do love prime rib but I felt bad about wasting food that would be the only negative would certainly come back

Excellent location near the 5th avenue and the subway. Took my sun meat lover for lunch, can't ask for better meat he ordered T-Bone steak and I took sirloin steak . The decor is old but new.. amazing. Excellent service helpful staff guided us. Enjoyed the best of New York Steakhouse experience, But, the price $$$$.

You can't have a better cut of meat anywhere else. And the decor was awesome. It has a lot of history and you get to read up on it. The steak is amazing and I wish I could visit more often. I saw bigger groups and obviously just couples, so it seems it can handle almost anyone. But, for the price I wouldn't take children.

column3: Old world charm with great food
column4: Was taken here by a colleague. Old world charm epitomised by wood panelled rooms and an amazing collection of clay pipes everywhere. Friendly and informative staff guided us to a shared porterhouse and mutton for which Keen's is rightly famous. Don't be put off - this isn't mutton as you might imagine it but rather tasty slices of pink, tender and flavoursome meat. The porterhouse was well hung and equally tasty and enjoyable. Atmosphere was great - not too business orientated and anyone would feel comfortable eating there. Will be back as soon as possible .  tenderpink cooked

This restaurant was fantastic. My husband +i went for an anniversary lunch here and as soon as we opened the door the maitre'd made us feel very welcome... We dined in the lincoln room, with its wood panelling and lovely tables overlooking the street. My husband had the dry aged T-bone steak and i had the filet mignon with sauce au poivre, they both just melted on the tongue... We followed our servers advice + just had one serving of baby new potatoes between us as the serving was quite large + the panroasted cauliflower/broccoli and sauteed mushrooms were just right. It was a shame that we had no room for dessert as they looked good. The service was also excellent and deserved their tips as they were very attentive. I loved looking at the names on the smoking pipes on the way out, that was fun but glad they are not in use now...
I have been to a lot of steakhouses but this one stands out. My wife and I were in the city to see a show for our anniversary and we went here as well. What a great experience.

I went to keens this weekend during a conference for work. Went with group of 8 colleagues. Food was good, just not great. Waiter spilled wine, and forgot drink. Wasn't bad at all, just didn't blow my mind. Will try new steak restaurant next time I go.

No doubt well worth a visit, a highlight in our NY trip. We had the Porterhouse with vegetables and a glass of Cabernet. The service was perfect and we made it in time to our Broadway show. Will definitely go back.

We booked via 'Open Table' without any problems. We always eat here every time we come to New York. Lovely atmosphere, great food and wine/beer. Would recommend the Porterhouse steak for two. Probably the best steak I've eaten.
Beautiful steak in a series of rooms in central Manhattan. Not cheap though! make sure to book as tables go quickly.

column3: Nice steaks in a cosy atmosphere
column4: Nice, good quality steaks in a romantic atmosphere. The servers are good but could have explained the menu a little better. Be sure to ask whats included in each dish so you don't order extra sides.
Service is good; food is excellent! The side dishes are too big- definitely share! Make sure you have a reservation or plan to wait for quite sometime! I would strongly recommend this steakhouse!

column3: New York Steakhouse at its best!
column4: It captures Nyc's ambiance of yesterday GREAT FOOD HONEST FLAVORS, no modern "haute-cuisine" nonsense. Loved it, highly recommended as a tourist "must".
What a Rib Eye!! You will love it and never forget it!! New York City must go place for good meat. And the location wonderful!!
Had the prime rib, it was perfectly cooked and very tender. My wife had the mutton chop which was huge! Service was good and the restaurant was very busy with a great vibe.
Visited on 21st September with my husband. Both had filet mignon, was cooked perfectly. Our server was great and even recommended a punk bar for us to visit during our stay
The steaks are very tangy and succulent seasoned to perfection paired with a great beverage selection. Service is intuitive and welcoming. Vist again
We really liked the t-bone and the traditional lamp meat service was nice also i would recomend it to every one

Definitely a landmark restaurant, the signature dish is the Mutton Chop which is enormous. Th service is impeccable bookings necessary but well worth the effort. Large range of dishes, great choice and food is superb.
Fabulous 'T' Bone steak. Historical and interesting. Good service and great food. Close to Times Square.
Arrived in the City Saturday evening, hungry and came across this place. Delicious good, massive portions. Yum!
The most fantastic steak ever - melted in my mouth. This restaurant is full of character and has great ambiance.

not much really to complain about, steak was cooked perfectly and appetizers were excellent as well. service was impeccable. why 4 stars? well, the prices. $$$$ really. great place to visit if someone else is paying the bill.

Well, we (my wife and I) have been, more than once, to : Ben.Bensons , sparks, Smith and wollensky, Gallagher's, Peter Lugar's, Ruth's Chris, and on--- finally-- Keens -- attitude 2, atmosphere--3, meat 10, overall --5/10

column3: Atmospheric traditional Steak House with beautiful food
column4: Atmospheric traditional Steak House with beautiful food. The Porterhouse Steak was cooked to perfection & the spinach side was perfect.

Visited with my daughter and we both absolutely loved our meal. Both had fillet mignon perfectly cooked and shared sides of mashed potato and saut√©ed spinach. Peppercorn and mushroom sauces also good. Champagne cocktails also lovely. Will definitely return on next trip.
This gem has turned into my favorite steak house in NYC. We live the hash browns and the steak is always cooked to perfection. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

column3: NYC Landmark for steaks and atmosphere
column4: The place is a true American steakhouse, very busy and ideally located next to Madison Square Garden. The steaks are fantastic, the sides very generous and the wine choice excellent. The service was good too. A great experience.
This was a nice getaway from the hustle and bustle of NYC. The porter house for 2 was superb! And the spinach...awesome!! Thanks for a romantic quite evening!
It's a place to remember. Wonderful st eak, tender, many options. Even the bar, where you stay while waiting for your table, is a nice place.Exquisite decor.
The restaurant has a nice atmosphere, cool history and friendly staff. However, the food was just average and by the way, all the steaks are very, very large. The cost is also very high.
It's been in business for a long time. Exceptional steak and service. Setting is unique and the history of the place is impressive. Impressive single malt whiskey collection.

Very nice restaurant and I suppose popular because we had to wait a few minutes to be seated. All worths as the steaks are grilled in another way thats why all are perfect. Wine list should be examined.

Be prepared to pay a lot but what you get is well worth it; our steaks were amazing. Restaurant is beautiful and atmosphere great. Service was friendly. A restaurant you should go to once whilst in NYC - but save up the pennies.
Was finally able to get keens of my check list when I was in NY this week! It lived up to my expectations. Had baccon, crab cake, and fillet. All were delicious!

Without a doubt, the best steak I have ever had in my life - so tender and melted like butter! The Prime Rib of Beef was superb and I cannot fault Keens! The service, food and atmosphere make this a very special place.

NYC's best steakhouse and the competition is stiff. The signature Mutton Chop is amazing and the Prime Rib a delight..melts like butter (1.5lbs of butter). Great atmosphere, noisy but fun. The bar has one of the best collections of single malts anywhere

This is an amazing restaurant. Good service, good foo and good vines. Very interesting decor and interior. The meat was so tender i could not believe it. Recommended indeed.Prices are a bit stiff but it is worth every cent.
We had a family birthday dinner here and the steak was fantastic (try the lamb too - delish!). Very good service and interesting history make this a spot to visit when you crave some meat!

Came here for my Partners 21st Birthday. We both opted for the T-Bone and honestly, it's the biggest we've ever had! The service was also very good. I'd recommend to walk off your Steak by visiting the Empire at Night haha!
Probably best filet I have ever eaten. Service impeccable. Will definately return next time we are in NYC! highly recommend!

If you want to experience one of the oldest Irish restaurants in NYC this is it. The wait staff provide exceptional service and helps make the experience. The food is very good. Get the enormous Mutton chop. Why not experience it.
Best steak I've ever had, and I eat at many steakhouses in London on business. Can't wait to go back to NYC and Keens will definitely be visited when I do.

We visited keens twice last trip, both at lunch times. It is a quality steakhouse and i really enjoyed my steaks. I had T-bone and Kings cut prime rib with fries!! loved it. Creme brulee was perfect, no complaints.
Atmospheric old chop house displaying hundreds of old clay pipes on the ceilings. Went on a packed Saturday night and had good oysters, steaks and wine served by friendly waiter. Would recommend
Just do it. ‚Ñ¢üëåüèªOutstanding service and food. Our waiter Nick was awesome. Not sure if tipped him enough? The wine was killer and I'll be back next time I'm in the city.
The atmosphere is absolutely amazing the food was beyond delicious steak cooked and taste perfect the fries are absolutely amazing and the bacon appetizer was beyond belief it's a must must must!
The best meal we had in NYC when visiting for NYE. Quality of the food and service could not be faulted. A real gem.

column3: Rare steakhouse close to Times Square
column4: Ate here recently and enjoyed the old school steakhouse experience. Steak was thick and delicious and service was quite good. Would go back again.

column3: Great restaurant, but there are better
column4: The service, and atmosphere where excellent, but the food was only great... which isn't good enough for the price.

My husband and I are here during our stay in New York. We had to wait for a table because we didn't make a reservation (I would highly recommend doing so if you have the time beforehand). We waited at the bar which was busy...More

We totally enjoyed our meal at Keen's. I was a bit apprehensive because I thought it would be all hype, but it was wonderful - clubby atmosphere, chock full of history, the food was exceptional and service attentive yet not overbearing. Expensive, but I'm worth it ha ha!

I've dined at Keens a couple of dozen times over the years. It's a neat historic New York steakhouse, with quality traditional steakhouse fare, a nice wine list and very good service. I've truly never had a bad meal here and always enjoy coming back. Try the porterhouse for two. Cheers!

I had a short visit to NY planned and one of the things my kids (15 & 12 years old) wanted to do was have a great steak in Manhattan.  The service was very good and the restaurant had a great 'buzz' around it. We ate upstairs and walked up a creaky staircase which gave us the impression that we were dining 100 years ago and felt nice. The restaurant has the largest collection of long clay pipes (church pipes) in the USA. They are displayed on the ceiling and looked amazing.  Let's get down to the food. We didn't eat any appetisers as the steaks were huge. Both my kids and I ate T-Bone steaks that and were 24oz's. They were cooked to perfection. We had asparagus, spinach and fries for sides and that was plenty for 4 people. My wife had Sea Bass and again this was cooked well. We couldn't fit in desserts!  Overall it was excellent, food, service and experience. The only down side was the price, which for 4 people came up to $350. My wife had a glass of wine and I had a Keen's Ale, so a little pricey. But ask me the question would I go again. The answer is YES!

My wife and I had a fantastic meal at Keens whilst visiting from the UK. The decor is really interesting and has a really nice relaxed atmosphere, the customers included family groups, couples and friends. Service was excellent, helping us to choose which steak best suited our tastes. The food was fantastic, steak was beautifully cooked and very tasty. Desert was absolutely huge and we could easily have shared one! Overall, very good and not bad value either compared to a similar establishment in London.

Kinda dissapointed , as I made this reservation a month ahead of time, asking for a main dining room table for our once in a lifetime visit to NY with our granddaughter and was assured they would take care of us. We got put in a corner upstairs. Put a pall on the whole evening. The steaks were fine, the service adequate, I would not go again tho, just ok.

We ordered mutton chop (their specialty) and T-bone. We could not finish everything so we decided to share the mutton chop and take home the T-bone. It's definitely their special and loved the dish. T-bone was ok, nothing stands out about it. The atmosphere is something different with all the pipes as decoration. There are room for improvement, hence the 4 star review.

Visited Keens on Saturday night with my 11 year old. We had a fantastic dinner, by far the best filet mignon we have had in a long time! The service was good too. I think we could easily have shared the filet with the 2 sides that we ordered because it was a lot of food. My only complaint is that the seating can be tight. Our table had to be moved just to get around the table next to us. Other tables were a bit more private.

column3: Rare steakhouse close to Times Square
column4: Ate here recently and enjoyed the old school steakhouse experience. Steak was thick and delicious and service was quite good. Would go back again.

column3: Great restaurant, but there are better
column4: The service, and atmosphere where excellent, but the food was only great... which isn't good enough for the price.
I visited keens steakhouse alone late at night. I ordered a sirloin steak with wine and some sides, and it was SO delicious!! I think it's the best steak I ever had.

Visited with wife with lots of expectations. The place looks good. The waiter was great and gave us good recommendations. We took the T-Bone and one fillet. Both were great. The wine was good and so was the creme bruillet. Great experience.

The best steak! Yes. In a steakhouse you expect to eat steaks, but this one has been different: unique! the best one I've ever eaten in my life. Best than in South Africa or Argentina too. Really excellent!

Had dinner and we both had the steak. It was cooked to perfection. The only downside was that we both felt as though we were being rushed. Other than that, we had a great meal and will definitely visit again.
We ate on the third floor and the whole place was busy. The quality of the food is high and the service matches. Good wine list. Its pricey but I guess it is to be expected in Manhattan.

Great atmosphere. Very good waiter. Everything was good, but I was expecting more. Had steaks as good or better in many places. If you order a baked potato at other steak houses you get many more condiments. Iceberg wedge salad was blah

column3: We all got the Cobb Salad!
column4: Well, all except one of the six in our group got the Cobb Salad. We were not disappointed! From ambiance to our lunch, we enjoyed the experience. We made reservations the day before.

Had NY Sirloin.The Wife had daily Fish..both done so perfectly it was amazing..Pan Roasted vegetables were out of this world too! Great Service..BUT..make res 7 days a week as we found on a Tue! at 7 pm..only waited 1/2 hr though so well worth it...
Food was excellent , but pricey. Prime rib was the best we have had . We will be going back next time we visit New York
The T-bone steak was out of this world .... And the setting and service was at thoe standard to match the food A must !!

column3: Best place for a nice dinner
column4: This restaurant lived up to its ratings. It was a little pricey, but hey, you are in New York. The steaks are simply the best. Really nice atmosphere. I will go back.

The best meet I have ever had before. Try mutton chop and prime rib. Absolutely delicious. With 2 bottles of Australian wine. By the way, they have the most wide Scotch Menu. We had single malt 15years Yamazaki.
Always a bonus when the food is excellent and there is history behind the joint. I should have bought a keepsake pipe. Will definitely go back.

column3: Divine! Do not hesitate in eating here!
column4: Perfect service, perfect atmosphere, gorgeous steak....everything was completely perfect. Thank you for the historical experience!

we did a lot of research trying to decide what steakhouse in NYC to go to. we choose Keen's and were not disappointed. the filet was great, the service was fantastic. it is a little pricey but definitely worth it
Fantastic place, fantastic food and a fantastic history. Staff very helpful, skilled and pleasant. Strongly recommened!
Really enjoyed our dinner at Keens. Perfect steaks in very nice, traditional surroundings. Place oozes history and style. Great service too. All in all, this is THE steakhouse in NYC.
Classic New York steak house complete with clubby atmosphere and old pictures on the walls. Steaks to die for. Drinks, hors d'ouevres, desserts all wonderful.

column3: A great dinner or lunch place near Empire State Building
column4: Great burgers if you are near the Empire State Building. Warm and cozy pub, and restaurant. Enjoy a quaint lunch or dinner. Salads are enormous. Great prime rib hash.
The restaurant is located in a easy to find place. The service was excelent starting with the reception service and then waiters and wine specialist. The food was delicious.
This boasts the largest collection of churchwarden smoking pipes. Pricey but filets were excellent. The mutton chops can feed a family of 6.
The food was very good. The service was also very good. The restaurant is a bit pricey but you are in NYC. I would definitely go back if I am ever back in NYC.
Amazing steak, huge portion, good Wine, gentle waiter, good and easy localization, we had a very agradable night, nice place, everything ok
We had the porterhouse for two and a Maine lobster. Both have been absolutely great. The selection of wine dessert and liquor is great too. So next time in NYC we come again.
Great food, Great Sevice and Great times. We have the Porterhouse for 3 that was superb! The overall experience was worth the slight delay for our table.. Good wine as well. Well worth the price

column3: Good food let down by inattentive service
column4: Absolutely packed on a Monday night and great dining room. Food up to scratch but service left you with the impression they couldn't give a toss with long waits for the mains without an explanation. Thus not paying the apparent mandatory New York 20% tip

We went here after seeing a show and the food was very good. My wife and I ordered steaks and both were delicious. You will need reservations. Place is more rustic decor, a bit different than I expected but a good meal!
Everything what you need to spend a lovely night out with your family. high standard service and high quality food. Higly recommended.

We've never had a better steal than the one at Keens...it is simply the best by a long, long way! We were a little worried that it wouldn't be as good...our fears were unfounded...once again the steaks were simply divine...truly great food.
Better make a reservation if you want a table. I ended up sitting at the bar which was fine. Got to watch US Open on TV. Fantastic filet mignon always.

column3: Great food in a historic environment
column4: I can highly recommend this restaurant for excellent service and great food. One of the best steakhouse at Manhattan , New York

column3: THE BEST STEAK IN THE CITY
column4: Keen's is tops in historical setting,impeccable service,relaxed environment and the very best food! Their specialty mutton is something memorable. When in New York ---KEEN'S üòÉ
Huge collection of smoking pipes on display of famous politicians and celebrities in the waiting area. Had lobster for starter - amazing! Had the most fantastic steak - cooked perfectly.
A bottle of champagne chilling when we arrived, as requested, and a 40-year-old scotch topped off a memorable New York strip!
My wife and I love Keens! I'm keen on the mutton chop. My wife doesn't like lamb so she digs the filet! Love it all...go there!
Best steakhouse in mid-town Manhattan. We go every year for a nice dinner before a show and it has always and I mean always been good.
Perfect medium stake with the perfect selection of whiskeys, also the prize werent bad as club a steakhouse and also better staff
You have to try this restaurant. Brilliant food, wine and Service! Made our Anniversary meal very special. Would recommend and return!!! Bottle 603 and the chateaubriand!!! ;)

column3: GREAT FILET, GREAT FRIES, AND ATMOSPHERE
column4: Had a great meal at Keens. The service was excellent, the good was great, and an all around good experience.
We went to Keen's based on trip advisor recommendations and we are glad we went! Steaks were delicious! Worth the trip! We booked well in advance as tables get snapped up quickly

column3: Great food and a convivial atmosphere.
column4: Oh, boy! Juicy steaks. Succulent lamb chops. Heaps of potatoes. Great bread. Veggies galore. Old clay pipes add to the ceiling beam and photograph decoration. Really great food and worth what it costs.

After waiting a while as we didn't book and arriving to the table slighting merry ! We sat down to a wonderful meal can highly recommend the mutton chop was amazing. Good vibe in the restaurant and of course the portions were huge!

column3: Great food & atmosphere all in one
column4: Try the bacon appetizer! Go in with a big appetite, or be ready to share an entree. The service is second to none!
The steak size and quality are the best you can find, wine selection is great and there is something for all. Side dishes are large portions, the potato two can share. Expect excellence!

Reassuringly expensive. Steak in the UK is ok at best. Steak at Keens ........mind blowingly good!. Tender, juicy and flavoursome. Fantastic surroundings filled with history. In my opinion the greatest piece of beef I have ever eaten. A firm recommendation.
This steakhouse taste is 4.5 atmosphere 3.5 table setting 3.5 service 3.5 clean 4.0 beverage 4.5 wine 5,0
One of the best steak houses you can visit, simply 5's all around. You get exactly what you pay for.

column3: This is a New York meal
column4: What can we say ? From the Dark and Stormy to the chocolate mousse and Gran Manier & all of that great steak and mutton chop in between. Do not forget your spinach and boiled potato side dishes.
The food was superb! nice atmosphere, attentive staff, and a very convenient location, we have visited this restaurant several times and have never been disappointed.
BeSt filet mignon ever. I have never seen a bigger choice of scotch and service was impeccable. Great location a must if you visit New York
First time in NYC heard good things about keen had to come had the Best steak I ever had well worth the price

We visited this bar, not the restaurant, 3 times on our recent trip to NYC. Simply a really comfortable bar with great friendly staff particularly the guy from South Africa. Fantastic wide range of spirits, possibly the biggest ever. Heard great things about the food.

I love New York. I love steak. I love history. So that means I love Keens. The food was a carnivores wet dream. The staff were an absolute delight. Ronnie , Brandon & Mohammed made a great meal a fabulous memory. Thank you so much.
Great Food! Wine was not so delicious. Dessert and Coffi good. Great Service. In the near of the Metro-Hotel.
Porterhouse Steak was one of the best ever tasted. From the winelist would recommend Russian valley Sonoma Zinfandel. Fantastic choice for a pre-MSG dinner.
Very creative and unique atmosphere of old gentlemen club. Food is Fantastic and service is very good we loved the place and location is easy to access.

We had lunch here on New Years Eve, shared the porterhouse for 2 - one of the best steaks I've ever had! Was so big we weren't actually able to finish the sides we'd ordered! Drinks were also reasonably priced
In short this has to be the best steak we have ever had!! Easy booking, great service and THE most delicious food cooked to perfection!!
Lovely place with excellent food. In Keens I had the largest steak I have ever seen. We went there with friends after our wedding and it was a great experience. Enjoyed every minute!
Visited with wife and 10 year old son. Had the Porterhouse for two ordered medium rare. Fantastic steak.

column3: Great steaks, but very expensive with average service
column4: Yes, the steaks are great (try the porterhouse!), but for the price I would hope for a higher standard of service (maybe it was an unlucky night?)

There's an impressive selection of seafood on Keens menu. I first had an appetizer of a half-dozen oysters. They were high quality for sure, and not cheap. My entree was the sauteed jumbo shrimp, and they really were jumbo! Served with spinach.
Just pretend you are not using real money. Its very expensive. Food was exceptional and atmosphere very very noisy and crowded. I will not be back

Keens is a superb chop house with intriguing historical ambiance hearkening to its 1885 origin. Food is great, whiskey list is amazing. Always a memorable evening. Convenient parking is a lot across the street.

I agree with the earlier subscriber and we may have been there on the same night! Unwelcoming staff and we asked for a menu three times. Not a smile from any member of staff other than at the front desk all evening.
we recommend this restaurant for its central location, kind people serving, very good soups and meat

Final evening before returning to Australia and my associates choose well. Steaks were full of flavour and though expensive the cuts of meat were large. Service was exceptional and could not recommend more highly. Wl done Keens!!

we went last night the the restaurant. we ordered chateaubriand and tbone steack. The meat's quality is very low. tasteless, dry, and not exciting at all. already eaten much better steaks, even in europe. place to avoid.
Excellent service and excellent food! Drinks from the bar were made to perfection. I will go back, its an old restaurant with a nice feel of intimacy.

The resturant was right down the street from our hotel and was the perfect end to our holiday! The steak was amazing, expensive but worth the money as a treat! The place was really unique with smoking pipes lined up on the ceiling! Excellent service!
I was blown away last time, so I was worried that I would come away disappointed. Somehow Keens did it better! Great meal, great service, great drinks... Keep it up!
Lovely atmosphere and wonderful food. The staff made us feel welcome and service was quick. Definitely worth a visit.

column3: Looking for an American steak? Visit this place!
column4: This was my first visit to Keens. It is THE steakhouse! The service is great. The resturant feels like the 1920s
A great steakhouse, probably the best in NYC. The quality of the steak is outstanding. The service is professional and attentive. Will come again and again when back in the City.

column3: Our best meal in New York
column4: Everything was great! If you want a delicious steak and feel like treating yourself, this place is for you. The service is wonderful and the ambiance is just perfect for a special evening out.

The most amazing steak ever. The whole experience was brilliant, had to wait in the bar for half hour but that was fine as loved taking in the NYC atmosphere. Then taken to our table and the service and food was outstanding. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
This was recommended to us buy several people, it was well worth the visit, I would go back tomorrow. It is not too expensive but really really worth every penny! Another MUST do !!

Great steakhouse with a long history, a must see and must taste while in New York! Don't miss to try their mutton chop, I'd say it's their signature dish but basically all their meat dishes are exceptional!
What's not to like. Steaks are amazing, dining room full of character and history. May be considered expensive by some but for me it's worth every penny
The Porterhouse was perfect! for my husband and brother in law, no need for starters as they brought a basket of bread and another basket of crudites and olives with dips
Absolutely amazing steaks, I don't think I will ever have as good as I received in this restaurant. Excellent service. Will come again when back in the City.

I visited Keens with my husband around the holidays. The service and food was outstanding! My husband is a steak fanatic and this restaurant put mine to shame...I begged the staff for its recipe! looking forward to returning soon!

Celebrated our silver wedding anniversary meal at keenes on 17/3 .. Excellent service and outstanding food and wine ..lovely decor and impeccable service , highly recommended .. Complimentary champagne too for our anniversary - lovely touch üòÑ
Book early. Dinnerroom closed 3 to 5 pm. Book for seating in dinnerroom. The Porterhouse was perfect!
Food is excellent, wonderful, the best of New York! Reservation is required although they allow walk-ins but you won¬¥t have the nicest tables.
very nice restaurant and bar,we visit this place for lunch,we order a t bone steak and the smoke steak sandwitch,was very tasty!!
I was in the city for some training and decided to treat myself to a Good steak dinner. i was not disappointed. Great appetizers, Steaks and awesome Key lime pie.
A must for any steak lover. Simply delicious and also try the mashed potato. Friendly staff and lovely atmosphere. A highlight from our trip
My husband and I have been twice. Get the Porterhouse for Two!! And the creamed Spinach! So yummy! You won't regret it.

ORDER THE MUTTONCHOP! wont be sorry. Incredible service, walking distance from Times Square. Very nostalgic atmosphere. Only concern if any, seated is a bit ways away from restroom. The food and nice waiters definitely make up for this. Had a blast. THANKS KEENS

My son and I are foodlovers and we wanted to experience " the best steak in NYC" during our stay. Definitely among "the top 5 ever". Huge portions and quite ok to ask for a doggie bag. Very attentive and effective service. We can recommend!

Step back a hundred years into the old smoking club that is now the pipe festooned steak bar of choice in mid town. Magnificent steaks, intimidating lamb, starve yourself all day, skip the appetisers and just wallow in a carnivorous dream.
The place is a bit crowded The sides were very good and the service excellent A bit too expensive for my taste and the fillet and mutton where good but not something out of this world

I was so excited about the huge steaks! And you should also try their excellent cheesecake. On Hallst.com I created my own map of cool places to eat in New York, check it out http://www.hallst.com/en/map/best-restaurants-in-new-york-45/map

My wife's steak was great. I had lamb chops. Fortunately, they were huge. The first one was excellent. The second lamb chop was all fat and inedible. I did not complain because one huge lamb chop was enough for me.

The porterhouse for 2 was enough for a family without the sides. It was tender and delicious and the best steak ever. Red wine was also very good. Thoroughly enjoyed our evening there. Its a must for the best steak but obviously not cheap.
Had the Chateaubriand and it was to die for! Service was great, wine was great and the place was heaving, even on a monday evening. Booking online in advance is reccomended!

Celebrating our 34th wedding anniversary. Steaks are perfectly done and delicious, side dishes as well. A little loud, but worth it. Complimentary dessert was sent to our table because our celebration. Highly recommend it.

We didn't have a reservation but we tried it on the off chance based on its reviews on trip advisor and its close proximity to our hotel. The steaks are cooked to perfection, seasoned beautifully and are really big portions! Fantastic!

Highly recommended steakhouse for lunch or dinner in hear of garment center. Built in 1800's with century old smoking pipes adorning ceiling.... and the food... excellent. Eat there at least once a week. Old NYC charm.

column3: Great alternative to some of the better know
column4: Keens is a great alternative to some of the better know steak houses. You will find the basic steak house menu and unfortunately the same prices, but the historic atmosphere is the tie breaker.
I was here 2 days ago and I normally dont wirte Reviews. Anyway it was wonderfulf. Nice Service, Amazing Steaks and the perfect Restaurant to finish a NYC Trip... I will come back ! BR

I wanted to go to a steakhouse near my hotel and I was recommended Keen's. It was a classic NYC steakhouse with wonderful decor and a great staff. They make great cocktails and out of this world steaks. I would definitely go again.
Yeah, amazing interior, amazing food,and amazing experience. Chateaubriand Steak was so good, that I could get one more for to go. Keens.
I most likely had the best T-bone steak of my life. We also received great service from staff that proudly did there job. The negativ part is that quality is also costly..
We ate there last night as walk ins , I can honestly say the steak was one of the best ive ever eaten . This restaurant is a must if staying in manhattan
Great food, ambiance and service. Hard to get in, reservations well in advance are needed. It's also quite pricy
12 ingredient salad to start, a porterhouse and a decent bottle of red, all to share. The steak was close if not the best that I have had and I will definately be back.
We all had different steaks, I had a porterhouse and it was so tender. We ate early and did get in without a reservation but we are told that this is a rare occurrence.

My boyfriend and I have tried many steakhouses but this place has the best steak I have ever tasted. I really liked the sauce they have and I just can't wait to go back. Make sure you make reservations!
Not cheap but you get what you pay for, high quality food, drink and service. Key lime pie was the best ever. The surroundings were fab, if it's great steak your after this is the place for you
Probably THE best Prime Rib in NY. Sometimes you need a classic amongst all the trendy places. Especially in the winter this place feels like going home

I loved this Restaurant, crisp linen table cloths, a coat check, lovely friendly staff. Steak very expensive but worth it. sides also expensive. Comprehensive wine list and cocktails. if you fancy a real treat and are a steak lover, this is a must.
Got to share dinner with daughter and son in law. We had a fabulous dinner and amazing service. Reservation is a must but well worth it.

We went here the night of my son's wedding for dinner. We were not disappointed! We enjoyed a great seafood platter appetizer, steaks for dinner and to-die-for desserts! A meal that will long be remembered!
Took the Mrs and we had the Chateaubriand. Have to say it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly! The staff were all very friendly and the ambience is also great. Can't wait to go back.

Honestly could not fault this place, Keens Steakhouse made the nicest steak i have ever had! I ordered the T bone Steak The crackling & the sirloin melts in your mouth!! i will definitely be returning next time im in the city!!

column3: Great steak place before going to MSG
column4: Love going here before games or concerts at Madison Square Garden. Typical NY steak place with an extra historical flair. The mutton chop make for a different experience.

column3: Great steak, great atmosphere, great bar & great staff - whats not to like?
column4: The title says it all ! Book in advance - it's popular for a reason! We had fantastic cocktails in the bar pre dinner.

Quintessential NYC steakhouse - food, service, ambiance - we last dined here about 22 years ago; returned this past December, 2014 and were happy to see there had been no adverse changes in this terrific restaurant. We can absolutely recommend it highly.

Very good restaurant with fantastic history, the clay pipes on the ceiling so much history, we had a wonderful meal here, good service, but I must say the bar staff were a little snobby/ The food was top class.

We really enjoyed our meal here, good quality steaks, good portions and nice atmosphere. Service attentive and helpful and nicely decorated dining room, only slight complaint was that the restaurant was quite cold. Would definitely recommend!
That's a great place - and the best fillet mignon I've ever had in my life. A must go, if you're in the city. No wifi, which is a shame.
We had the mutton - Fantastic! Excellent service, great food, lovely surroundings - we loved it and will go back. Compare it to Rules (in London). I wouldn't change a thing.
Went to a Holiday Party at Keen's. The food is terrific. The staff was wonderful, especially, Dorothy, Sandy and Nick. Can't wait to go back and enjoy a fabulous meal

column3: Better options in NYC for steak
column4: I've avoided Keens for years specifically because I've heard tepid reviews from friends. Let's just say it is never #1 on any 'best steak in New York' list that I've come across, now including my own.
Fantastic food, great service and an historic building. Was given a synopsis of the history of the building by a very friendly barman. The best meal we had in NYC. Loved it.
we hadn't made a reservation but were seated within 20 mins. really attentive staff and the food was Fantastic. I really recommend the Mutton chop "WOW".

Went with friends and had some very nice steaks, various cuts all cooked correctly. Oysters Rockefeller was on point too. Can't beat the vibe and decor for a steakhouse IMO. Very cool upstairs/downstairs areas and bars with lots of character.
It was a great night with the ambience, old pipes at the ceiling and delicious steaks. But I think the newspapers on the walls are just a little bit racist.
Wow great steak, chicken, and side dishes. Awesome service very nice ambient so far the best place we have eaten this trip

The location is great - close to Macy's and we were in town for holiday shopping. The food was excellent from start to finish, including the mutton chop (which lived up to its "legendary" tag on the menu). Service was flawless.

A classy, traditional NYC steakhouse with a good array of fine food. Prices are steep, however. I suppose you get what you pay for, but my budget won't handle $200-$300 per meal. Definitely "big night out" fare.

column3: The best dry aged beef over the world
column4: For me, Keens is the best dry aged T bone stake over the world. M√©at is tasty, so tender... One of my best New York souvenir

Old Fashioned and used to be a Man's Bar atmosphere, now all is lively and women also frequent Keens. A treat for all because it is old time NYC! A lovely place for tourists to experience even though it is off the beaten Path!

Saw a review on this steakhouse and decided for our group to go. Very nice wine list..Short wait. Good service. The prime rib was very good and the horseradish/au jus was great. Desert was enormous....and very good.

column3: Amazing experience and ever better food!
column4: Took several clients out to a lunch a couple weeks back and we split several different steaks. Everything came out amazing and the experience we had was unforgettable. Will definitely return for both person and business.

If you're looking for an old school steakhouse, Keens definitely fits the criteria. The service was brilliant and the food was great! Would definitely recommend the lamb chops and having a drink in the bar before or after dinner.
We had our one year anniversary dinner here and the food was awesome.staff was very helpful in making our dinner to remember. We liked all the pipes on the walls and ceilings.food was awesome.

column3: Fine dining on a night out with my son in Manhattan
column4: Great food in wonderful surroundings. The collection of clay pipes is unique and the selection of whiskeys is second to none.
My hub likes the mutton chop however I think it's a dude thing. Fillet is great- sides are enormous- drinks are fabulous! You must try keens out just for the old school establishment

column3: Good quality and service, great atmosphere
column4: Walking distance from the Radisson Martinique. Very busy and booking essential. Great service and the quality of the steaks was excellent. Portions are huge so none of us were able to finish their plates. A shame they do not serve half size portions

Favorite steakhouse in NYC. Great Old New York atmosphere. Fun (crowded) bar scene of top NY dealmakers and the ambitious up and comers. Impeccable service, delicious food. Huge portions - be sure to share.

Keens has been in business forever. It is stayed around while many other steak houses have opened, had success and failed. The steaks are prime beef perfectly cooked. The service is excellent. The ambiance is a little funky but see for yourself.
A little disappointed with dinner at Keen's. The service & food were average at best. Not on the list for a return visit.

My mutton chop was so big, I've never seen anything like it! And delicious, my partner had the sirloin which was just as amazing! Not a cheap night but for special occasions would definitely recommend it.

Great service and atmosphere - loved the pipes on the ceiling and the story behind them. The food was excellent with my steak cooked to perfection and a good selection of meals for main and dessert and a solid wine list.
First time at Keens and was knocked out! Amazing steak, the best I have had. Waiter was something special, Yussuff I believe, and just added to the great evening we had.
Old school classy british style setting, restaurant plus pub. Rather pricey, noble and efficient staff, amazing food, very tender meat. Chimney in winter times. Not so convincing beers.
Went here based on a friends recommendation. It was spot on. Good food from the fish to the filet mignon. Everyone enjoyed their meals. Even the kids! A must visit.

Love the old world charm! Great service, non chain restaurant, ambiance is classic. Steaks done to perfection. Go have an appetizer and some wine by the fire. A mist during a winter trip to New York City.

We entertained friends visiting from LasVegas and they loved Keen's! The service was impeccable but friendly. The waiter shared the history with us! Buffalo Bill's pipe...really!! The drinks were excellent-the steak top notch. A special night...worth the expense.

column3: The best filet of my life!!!
column4: Excellent beef!!! very good contours and service.Very suggestive location in the heart of Manhattan!!!

Place quinte expensive bit excellent food. Warm structure. Professioinal waiters. Reservations nearly mandatory, we did no it get any seat on Saturday without reservatio. Reserved that night and went back on Sunday.

pace quinte expensive bit excellent food. Warm structure. Professioinal waiters. Reservations nearly mandatory, we did no it get any seat on Saturday without reservatio. Reserved that night and went back on Sunday.

column3: The best steak house in my whole life
column4: Non to mention the historical place, the meat was the best I've ever tasted - approaching Kobe beef, the service was raffin√© & we will definitively return to this restaurant !
Last day in New York and found the best steak house. Look at the pub menu there are great meals on there too, and much cheaper!
Keen's is very traditional and has a long history of good steaks ! But for me it not achieved my expectations ! BIG steaks, high prices, but at least for me, could be more tasteful.
Wonderful dining experience. Elegant in every way. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Manhattan and seeking a classic steakhouse experience.

Myself and my wife really enjoyed our food here, really good steak and all the accompanying items were great too. Apart from the food it is also a great place to be, nice bar area and funky dining room, with the pipes on the ceiling!
Overall a great experience , my mutton chop was cooked great and tasted amazing but be mindful there is a lot of marble/fat on the meat which I enjoyed. The mutton and a manhattan is the way to go!

column3: Traditional Steakhouse in the heart of mid town
column4: Keens has the feel of a traditional steakhouse. Ideal place for meat lovers. Mutton Chop is highly recommended but you need to have 'some' appetite to finish it. Roasted veggies were sumptuous. Must visit if you are in mid town.
I'm a meat lover, and I can say that I've had the best steak of my life whilst dinning at Keens Steakhouse. It's worth a trip.

column3: Old steakhouse in the heart of manhattan
column4: Centrally located and one of the oldest restaurants in Manhattan's Keen's is an institution. The food was good, not great, the service excellent and they accommodated us upstairs which gave more room then Being squeezed into a tiny sitting area. Make sure you get reservations!
Serious contender to best steakhouse in town. Steak was cooked and served to perfection. So were the other dishes. Definitely a place to come back to
Keens situated close to Times Square is one of New York's oldest and most traditional steak houses. The quality of the meat is first class and added to the service makes for a special evening

Very disappointed - very high prices would have expected a perfect steak but came overcooked ordered medium but arrived closer to well done - very disappointed - much better restaurants out there at half the price - AVOID - not worth it!!

column3: Great spot for business lunch close to Penn Station
column4: Went here recently and had a delicious and well staffed business lunch. Menu is diverse and reasonable and it is a quick walk from Penn Station. Atmosphere is clubby steakhouse but in a friendly way.

column3: Still one of the best steaks in the world
column4: The first time I went to Keens was 7 years ago, and it was the best steak I had ever tasted. 7 years on it still holds that crown. Perfectly attentive staff and a great 'curiosity' style interior. I can't recommend this place enough.

This Classic (it dates back to the 1800s) steakhouse serves a great steak in a clubby old school atmosphere. The service is professional and excellent. Nothing new or groundbreaking here - just good old fashioned meat and potatoes.

The T-bone was massive and delicious and creamed spinach the best I've tasted. Laid back, comfortable atmosphere. Highly recommend if you are looking for a good quality steak in this area of New York.

I like value for money I don't mind paying for quality food but this restaurant was expensive! Lovely cocktail list and the fillet mignon was good. The pipes on the roof a nice feature but could do with a dusting!

Very high quality meat cooked perfectly in an atmospheric restaurant with great service. Also, a superb wine list with very reasonable mark ups, less than 100% in comparison with most places which are 200%+. Not cheap but still great value. Will definitely go again.
Keens Steakhouse has one of the best steak ever! There I said it! so what are you waiting for, if you're in NYC, make your reservation now!

Yes, it's busy in there, yes you need a reservation, yes it's cramped and dark - but the steaks are amazing. I found a single seat at the bar, had prime rib and have NO regrets! Nice wine list, great food, attentive servers - go!
